Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Cecelia49
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel to stay in with friendly, helpful staff. The rooms are comfortable and clean with an en suite. A good breakfast was provided at convenient hours. There is a regular bus service to all areas of interest which once mastered made the visit so much easier and could be tackled with confidence. If you enjoy walking a lot of places are within reach giving you a good feel of the area. There are a lot of nice restaurants in the proximity and we enjoyed eating in places the locals frequented. Explore and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay city break”
Reviews.Author: Sue G
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely, service was friendly and excellent, breakfast had a wide choice and it's in a very good location next to a local landmark so easy to find

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: s_volante
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and I was very impressed with the overall service and condition of this property. Only drawback is the fact that it is not in a central location, but this is helped by the many buses that stop just outside the hotel. I also liked the quaint roof top seating area where you can relax with a drink and some nibbles.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful start in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sunnytrip365
Reviews.Content: Our room is very spacious and beautiful, it is even better than the pictures desplay on hotel's website, we like it very much. everything works well and we even got a kettle for tea. Our room near the garden, it's very quiet. Staff is nice. Breakfast is very rich. It's convenient to take bus to famous interest places. Rome is a large city if you visit on foot will be very tired. At first I was hesitant to book this hotel because some views not good, but my experience is much better than what I expected!

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: Pejman P
Reviews.Content: The worse hotel I even stayed in and I travel a lot. I had to move 3 times since either their bathroom do not work , shower do not work or there is problem with heat. Service sucks. I can not tell you how bad this hotel is..

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: Winsons
Reviews.Content: Service at the Turner Hotel was very good, beds were clean and comfortable and the towels were changed daily. The communal areas in the hotel were very nice. We felt let down by the rooms we were allocated. Our room was quite dull and the fabric on the walls was coming off in some areas, it was also very dusty. The door surround was coming away from the wall in the bathroom. In some areas of hallways the fabric was held on to the wall with masking tape and the carpets were threadbare.This is not what we would have expected from a hotel in Rome that has a 4 star rating. I think at the moment I would rate it as 2/3 star. A very important note I would like to make is, don't think that by using the safe in your room that your money and valubles will be safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: bbunke
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to our expectations, lovely large room overlooking the street, comfortable beds, nice rooftop. The location was perfect for us, buses right outside the hotel, 10 min. by bus to Termini, the Colosseum or the Trevi. Staff were generally very helpful. The breakfast was however very bland.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelT001
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel that lives up to the ornate Roman decorative style that lived in centuries past. The location is fantastic, close to Termini station and the all the major tourist attractions within walking distance. The staff were very friendly with a good knowledge of English language. The toilet in our room was very cosy with a large sink, but enough room to do what is necessary in a toilet. The breakfast catered for both continental and English tastes with the scrambled egg and bacon on buffet. For a 4 star hotel, it lacked room service and a pool, but we were quite satisfied with all the other elements.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Turner”
Reviews.Author: Family039
Reviews.Content: A super hotel with helpful, friendly staff. Extremely good value, we paid £42 for a two night stay in a triple room, fantastic value but to make it even better we were upgraded to a suite; it made a special birthday celebration even more special. Location is very good. Breakfast very good with a wide choice. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Jan”
Reviews.Author: Janette S
Reviews.Content: This hotel has bags of personality and a very willing and helpful staff. Location is good. Our room was quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was good with a wide choice of food and drink. Our hotel experience enhanced our holiday. Thank you to all at Hotel Turner and buona fortuna. We look forward to seeing you again when we return to Rome . Two helpful tips to travellers - never put notes in the bus ticket machine we lost 10 Euro and use trip advisor for restaurants - the two we visited were really good and gave our evening wanderings focus.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: LucyLocket001
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this Hotel. Staff extremely helpful at all times. Room very clean, beds extremely comfortable and also room very quiet(room 602). Breakfast continental style but hot scrambled eggs and bacon available. Hotel in excellent position for all the sights. Bus stop right outside the hotel. In the centre of Rome in about 20 mins. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting a hotel for sightseeing. Reading other reviews I can only presume that since they were posted the rooms have had a revamp.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tatiana_tatiana_2011
Reviews.Content: it is easy to find the hotel, we took 36 bus from termini station and the bus stop is really close to the hotel. the lady at the reception was friendly, our room was on the third floor 322 and is quite spacious, clean and comfortable. since on the last day we were leaving early in the morning, they prepared some croissants and juice to go for us which was nice

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but nothing terrible”
Reviews.Author: JJOH
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated by Porta Pia which is 15 mins walk from Termini station and reasonably convenient for all the sites. Staff helpful. Breakfast OK. Room tight and bathroom v small with some damp as I dont think the extractor fan was working v well. We paid just over £70 oernight bit B&B and at that rate I felt we got pretty good value but if you paid more you may not think so

Reviews.Title: “Not Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Laci F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in January and it was my least favorite hotel of the trip. The staff seemed irritated every time we asked for directions or a taxi, with the exception of one younger gentleman who was extremely helpful and spoke great English. We were supposed to have a room with 2 beds and we got a small room with only one full-size bed. The room was small even for European standards. There was a weird smell in our room through the whole stay which kind of took your breath away upon entrance. I will say that the room was very clean and the bathroom was spotless. I didn't mind the tiny shower but I can see how it would be a problem for some. Breakfast was pretty bad, with the exception of the fruit and pastries. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Julieanddarren
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, I booked it for my boyfriends birthday treat, first impressions were good apart from room had no view even though tour operator did request it and room was too small, could of done with coffee /tea facility's and shower room a bit biggar but apart from that staff very friendly, in a good location and really enjoyed seeing Rome

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Maltemania
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed five nights at the Hotel Turner this February. We had a wonderful stay in this charismatic and Roman-style decorated four-star hotel. The service was excellent - we got a free upgrade to their suite, due to some repairs in the room we booked! We spent one night in a regular room (which also was nice) and four nights in their suite (at no extra cost). The room was always clean, new towels and bed sheets daily, the internet (Wi-Fi) worked fine - everything worked as it should. The bathroom was really good (in both rooms) - hot water, enough space, clean toilet etc. The personnel were very friendly and good at English, eliminating communication problems. The breakfast was good (though, we could have done with some fresh fruit), elevators worked at all times - all in all making it a wonderful experience for us. The Hotel is located in Via Nomentana (Porte Pia), 1.5 km from Termini (main bus, metro and train station) and 3 km from the major sites. The major bus lines leave right outside the hotel, making transportation quick and very easy, making the location very good. The area is safe at night and there is no noise from traffic, people, many tourists, bars etc. We had a wonderful time in Rome and in Hotel Turner, which we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: amandabritton
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Turner through a deal i was sent, unfortunatly our room was lovely but like a shoe box, with a cold shower, someof the other rooms we peeped at where much bigger so make sure you ask for the larger rooms at the front of the hotel, Rome was Fantastic,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, on edge of City”
Reviews.Author: Shriggers
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here, rooms are very lavish in decor in a old fashioned way, first night it was freezing but they sorted heating out. About 20 min walk into centre but nice location. We paid for an upgrade which was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Turner Rome”
Reviews.Author: blaw01
Reviews.Content: We spent a 'very' long weekend in Rome around the Italy/England Rugby match. The location of the hotel was ideal for everything that we needed (despite the worst snowfall for many years). During our 6 day stay we found all of the hotel staff very pleasant and helpful and the standard of service was good. Our room was first class, bathroom very good, the noise from passing traffic was negligible. There was a good selection of items for breakfast and the staff were quick to replenish, tables were cleared efficiently. There was no Restaurant open in February but close to the hotel were several good places to eat, a lack of ability to speak Italian was no bar. In comparison with many hotels in the UK the value for money was excellence.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: judithmaryh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one niight only to watch the rugby The helpful staff ,gleaming brass work,spotless room and bathroom and good breakfast were beyond expectations About fifteen minute walk from the Rome Termini. We would certainly book there again for a longer stay - a perfect and reasonably priced Hotel It seems picky to say teamaking facility would have been desirable

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for walking/discovering Rome”
Reviews.Author: upfrontIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights.Mid Feb' - Hotel reception and staff efficent,informative,helpful.Room excellent - wanted for nothing. Bathroom perfect with shower v good - though little small.Breakfast excellent with wide variety and plenty of fare.Cocktail bar at night a little chaotic but none the less ideal to bring the day to a close.Location is ideal for walking Rome and discovering the city.Nice locality with plenty of good outlets for food/drink all to hand.Would have no problem staying there again the next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Rome for Italy v England Rugby International”
Reviews.Author: mikedwStirling
Reviews.Content: Just picked this hotel at random because a very good deal was on offer. I would definitely seek this Hotel out again - OK it might have seen better times but it had a lovely old fashioned Roman 'feel'. The staff could not do enough for us and because my son was unable to get back up north because of the snow ( yes, deep snow in Rome) - they allowed him to stay in my room for a very modest rate. The room was small but clean.The breakfast was fabulous - probably the best bacon and eggs l have ever tasted. The staff were lovely without being too 'gushing' in their customer service.The location is just outside the walls of the city near the government ministries. Just a 10 euro fare to the Vatican or plenty of buses leaving from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: proffitt76
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here for two nights in early February. Reception was efficient, the receptionist was very pleasant and helpful. The room was OK for our needs. Decorated to a reasonable standard. Decent bed, good shower (which I broke by fiddling with the Jacuzzi settings but the handy man repaired!). Mini Bar and TV (BBC World the only English speaking channel) and air conditioned. However, the air con was either broken or unable to heat sufficiently as since there was snow on the ground, the room was a bit “fresh”. Breakfast was good. Decent selection and quality. The hotel is located on the North side of the main railway station. Turn right out of the hotel and in 50 yards there several bus stops and a ticket machine. 4 euro for an all day ticket on bus, tram and metro. The main buses are the 60 that goes to the coliseum (there are loads of these) and the 62 that goes close to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Vatican etc. (we waited ages for this and none came). I was told every 10 mins or so but according to the Tourist Information office, there is no timetable!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe it was 4 star once”
Reviews.Author: longmantours
Reviews.Content: I wanted to really like the Turner hotel as it has charming decor, friendly staff and is in a pretty good location to see Rome however there were several niggles throughout our stay. We stayed at the Turner for 3 nights in February, which unfortunately co-incided with some very cold weather. However, I did not expect the cold weather to follow us indoors, up the lift, along the corridor and into our room! I could literally see my breath in the cold air of the lift and corridor. When voicing our concerns about how cold our room was I was told that several rooms also had no heating (we were not informed of this at check-in) and that we could not move rooms. To the hotels credit we were offered a heater over-night and more blankets. The heating was fixed later the next day. Our room was okay - quite small but fairly clean however the bathroom is very tired and the shower cubicle is tiny and the curtain sticks to you making showering a far from pleasant experience. Oh and water gets everywhere, so much so that we had to resort to using towels on the floor as make shift mats. Water temperature in the bathroom never really got above luke warm. I would also expect more in the way of luxuries for a 4 star hotel, e.g shower gels etc. Breakfast contained a good selection as previously mentioned however they are very slow at keeping food, cutlery, milk etc etc available and the tables cleared. As for the bacon and eggs being kept warm by two candles - this isn't really good enough. Overall I have to say that based on the above I would not stag again - a pity as the hotel in itself is actually quite charming.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but expected better.”
Reviews.Author: JoJoLovesToTravel_11
Reviews.Content: When arriving at Hotel Turner, I must say I was highly impressed by the cultural decor and the pleasant customer service we received. Unfortunately to say, I wasn't impressed with much more after that. It wasn't a horrible stay but at the same time it had none of the amenities that I would expect a 4 star hotel to have. When attempting to order a late night snack we realised that there was no room service so we had to leave the hotel to find something to eat. Neither did it contain the small luxuries a hotel should have such as bath robes and toiletries. The room was clean apart from the bathroom which was also clean but a bit dingy. Not to mention it was absolutely freezing. In the morning for breakfast we were disappointed with how slow the replenishment of food took, also we were disappointed by how long it took for someone to clean the tables that were left. We ended sitting on a table that had left over bacon from the previous person. As stated before, the people working there were absolutely pleasant, but unfortunately there's more than good customer service which makes a good stay for me. If you are looking for a clean place to stay whilst visiting Rome then I guess this is the place to go, but if you're looking for luxury then I wouldn't suggest Hotel Turner.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, clean rooms, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: lsc82
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in January 2012 for a 3 day break and were very pleased with this hotel. Located close to Termini and towards to north - east of the city we found it a good location with a bus stop right outside. We walked to most places around the city which from this location did sometimes feel a long way but I feel that you get the best experience of a city by walking, you see things you would miss if you jumped on a bus all the time. We found the room to be extremely clean, comfy beds although it was two singles pushed together so ended up with a small gap but this was no problem for us. Perhaps there could have been a folder in the room with some info about the hotel, how the a/c & tv worked, what time breakfast was served and some local info about buses etc but if you asked at reception the staff were always very helpful with good English. We dealt with 4 different reception staff and they were all very good but we wanted to say a special thank you to the man who helped us after my partner thought his wallet had been lost/stolen whilst out & about. He immediately phoned the last shop we had been visited to try to locate it which saved us a long walk back to try to find the wallet ourselves. Breakfast was very good - plenty of choice. Fresh cakes and pastries, cold meat and cheese, cereal, toast, yogurt, fresh juices, tea & coffee and set in a lovely dining room. Overall, we could not fault our experience at this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: john c
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 18th Jan 2012, The room allocated to us was quite adequate for our needs, clean and tidy.Breakfast was very adequate with bacon, scrambled egg, cold meat, cheese, toast and more. If you cannot find something to tickle your fancy then you must be a born moaner.Reception when we arrived was staffed by a VERY pleasant young lady, she imparted that much information in such a short time that the following day we achieved far more sight seeing by following her instructions than we could have done on our own.She is without doubt the Best receptionist we have come across in 40yrs of travel. An asset to the hotel,although all the staff were very friendly. Bus stop right outside the hotel and only 4euros for unlimited travel on the bus, metro and tram. Bargain. Thank you Hotel Turner and to the young lady in question.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: NIck B
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome in January 2012 for the Mondrian exhibition and chose the Turner based on reviews here. As suggested, we paid slightly more for a "superior" room. The room we were given was superb, the bellhop said it was the largest in the hotel - and while we have no way of judging that, it was the one they use in the hotel brochure (534 I think). The staff were great, the breakfasts provided the best selection we have found outside the UK and the location of the hotel is pleasant - walkable from the main rail station with shops nearby. I would recommend the Turner to anyone and happily stay there again if we ever return to Rome. I'll add a picture of the room in due course.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sammyann_xxx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant. Perfect situation away from city centre- however within walking distance of most things. Also bus route right outside which is highly convenient. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. There was a beautiful rooftop bar- with amazing friendly bar staff. Only down side of the hotel is the breakfast minimal selection- however good at the same time. Also within walking distance of central train station making transports from the airport simple.

Reviews.Title: “Not Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Ali M
Reviews.Content: Bought the deal from lastminute.com suggesting 60% discount for superior room (i paid £500 for 4 nights!!!!). At the check in first they said there is no superior room available and then accommodated us into a tiny double and said this is the superior room. when i asked to see another double bedroom so i could compare they refused to show me one. Long story short you will be paying for calssic furniture and that's all.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot near the centre of rome”
Reviews.Author: vlrsaracino8
Reviews.Content: My husband and i visited this hotel with my daughter and son in law for a spring break the hotel is in a good spot as it is situated near most of the tourist attractions the rooms are clean and spacious,the staff are very accomodating and the breakfasts are worthy of a 5* hotel theres even an original Turner painting in the sitting room we will definitely be returning to this hote.

Reviews.Title: “Turner Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: chestermolby
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel very helpful and friendly staff, good breakfast and plenty to choose from, not exactly central, however a bus stop directly outside the hotel gives access to most areas of Rome. Would I stay here again yes, the only down side I would say is that there were no coffee / tea making facilities in the room and the toiletries were a little sparce considering it is rated as a 4 star. Overall a positive and enjoyable experience a good value for the money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel , 10 mins from centre”
Reviews.Author: Rossy1234
Reviews.Content: I said here with my boyfriend 4 days ago the hotel is very clean cleaners come in every day , it is bb the breakfast isn't very nice thow I ended up cakes in the end and also the rooms are very hot the air con wasn't wring just full blown hot all the time but apart from that over all was good and the staff are helpful to I loved Rome was really good and loads to see .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Ilovenoodles79
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews I was rather apprehensive about my stay at this hotel. However our experience was really positive. On arrival we were greated with friendly staff who were helpful giving us a map, answering queries and informing us of local buses. The concierge took us to our room which was clean, tidy and sufficient. It was made up every day. Very friendly, helpful bar tender who helped me out when I needed a lighter. Breakfast was nice. Check out was very quick and efficient. The only downside is that there was only 1 english TV channel, but we were not in our rooms much so that is not a major issue. The safe in our room also didnt work, the concierge and reception tried to find a key but could not locate it and offered us the alternative of using the safe in the reception area. Again not a major issue. The whole stay was very good, great service and a good location, around 15-20 min walk to the Trevi Fountain/Pantheon area. Buses came right outside and were cheap and only 5-10 mins to other major attractions when we decided to use them.

Reviews.Title: “I definitely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: GBaroni
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Turner was unforgettable. The place is so beautiful, the breakfast was amazing, the service is impeccable and the hotel is very well located. I totally recommend it - and already have plans to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: AL_ManchesterUK101
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Turner over the last weekend in November - we had a pleasant superior room with plenty of space for 2 people. The room was clean and bright and bathroom facilities were good. The staff were always helpful and polite and the breakfast buffet was excellent - plenty of choice and well stocked. The location of the hotel was very convenient for seeing the city. There is a bus stop outside and a metro stop just a few minutes walk away. It is walkable distance from Termini Station too. All in all a good choice for a stay in Rome and certainly value for money. One question - why is the roof terrace not used as the cocktail lounge? - it seemed a bit wasted.

Reviews.Title: “couple from USA”
Reviews.Author: 248Lolo
Reviews.Content: beautiful elegant classical furniture throughout the hotel and in the rooms. Staff was ready to always help. The included breakfast was copious and of good quality. The location is out the tourist area and therefor calm with few very good pizzerias nearby. Busses are in front of the door. Although the rooms well beautifully decorated and large enough for european standard (We had a junior suite), the bathroom was completely out of style with the rest of the room. It was very small: the sink was fine but the shower was the kind that come with hydromassage but too small for anyone to turn in it. On top of this it was made of cheap plastic. It is very unfortunate, but unless the hotel changes the shower design and quality, I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for just sleeping in”
Reviews.Author: muttimouse
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good half hours walk from the Termini but well situated for sightseeing. Definately not worthy of 4 stars, but comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpfull. The overall appearance of the bedroom was it was a bit shabby and on the small side but the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom smelt abit drainy at times and was not overly clean, the shower was so powerful it flooded the bathroom floor and the shower door was very precarious. We were at the back of the hotel which we thought would be quiet, but there was building work going on somewhere from about 6.30am each morning. Breakfast was very good, although an extra charge of 2euros50 for a cappacino was excessive, but there was a good choice of food available. The bar was very friendly but very expensive 12euros for a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “bad choice”
Reviews.Author: Ntinos V
Reviews.Content: We spent ,with my wife, 4days in Rome in Oct and we chose this hotel because of the nice photos on the internet.Finally nothing was as on the photos.We changed room twice,at least the reception staff tried to be helpfull,but unfortunatelly all standard rooms were in a very bad condition. If you choose this hotel book only sup room.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Italian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Burscoboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Turner Hotel for 3 nights in November. I got a fantastic deal through hotels.com at a bargain price for bed & breakfast. From that viewpoint I thought that the hotel was absolutely fantastic and the best valued hotel we have ever stayed in. Our room was located on the 4th floor at the back of the hotel with rooftop views through large windows. It was very quiet. It had 4 metre high ceilings with ornate covings, ceiling rose and chandalier. The walls were entirley decorated with luxury fabric and the floors were marbled tile. The furniture was reproduction antique. The large bed was very comfortable. It resembled a bedroom in a grand house and in a very good way it was like sleeping in a piece of Italian history. So much nicer than all those chain hotels were every room is exactly the same. The shower room was a little small and could have done with updating – although everything was clean and worked perfectly. The public rooms again were very ornate with lots of marble and gilt mirrors. The staff were friendly. There was a great food selection at the buffet breakfast – the best I have had in a European hotel. Fantastic cakes and coffee - they even had bacon and scrambled eggs. The hotel is well located – only 15 mins walk from the train/bus station. The bus stop outside and takes you to locations all over Rome for only 1 euro. There are several various types of restaurants/pizzerias in the immediate vicinity. We found the Rossopomodoro pizzeria close by which was very good. On our last stay in Rome we stayed at another hotel and paid more than twice the price for it. The Turner Hotel was much nicer and we have had a wonderful Italian experience. I shall definitely look at booking this hotel again on any future trips – especially if I can get a good deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: ghui
Reviews.Content: The overall impression of this hotel is a good one. The hotel entrance is quite grand as is it's breakfast room. However, the rooms were not quite as grand. They were decorared in a fancy but old-fashioned style and our room was very small and box-shaped. It was not horrible or anything, but was maybe not what you would expect of a 4 star hotel. The bathroom was also very small and old. Saying that, everything was very clean. The location of the hotel was good. It was located next to a bus stop which provided good links around the city. The staff were very friendly and helpful at telling us how to get about the city. Overall - I would recommend this hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Distinctive!”
Reviews.Author: Oldprop3
Reviews.Content: The Turner Hotel is a bit of an enigma. It cerainly deserves its European version of 4*'s ( regular travellers from the UK will know what I mean), in that it is a beautiful property - a wonderful marble staircase, bedrooms grandly furnished with period pieces, bathrooms with everything you could require except a bath, and a pretty breakfast room.A lovely roof-top terrace, cocktail bar, in-room safes, fabric-clad padded bedroom walls and free wi-fi complete it's impressive assets. In addition, it is a third of a mile from the nearest Metro, in a good area with a bus stop outside the front door, and enough good restaurants in the locale makes the Turner an ideal place for a short stay. The only downsides we experienced were a) a slightly chaotic breakfast room with a harrassed overworked manager, supported by languid staff, could use some improvement; b) we were offered choice of 2 very small bedrooms which appeared to be standard size for the hotel. This was not a major problem for a 2 night stay, but would be an issue if coming for a week with related ammounts of luggage. All told we enjoyed our stay, but if you want American-sized rooms, then the Turner may not be for you unless you can swap size for style.

Reviews.Title: “Super Staff, Great Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi C
Reviews.Content: Great accommodations for the traveler! Nice rooms, GREAT staff, convenient location. This hotel was super clean and nicely decorated. The location is just STEPS away from the "62" bus stop which connects to everywhere the tourist wants to go in Roma. The staff is super-helpful with recommendations indoor directions. ** The hotel has a buffet-style breakfast included - it is mostly good with a number of choices which helps the tourist get through until the first lunch break!! The rooms were large and luxurious (on a European comparison). The beds were not too hard and not too soft. The walls were covered in an upholstered-type tapestry, which looked fabulous and I believe was there to reduce street noise. My group consisted of 4 women, and there was never a problem with "mirror-time" as there was enough space/mirrors to allow us to all pretty much get ready to go at the same time. There was a patio/balcony on the top floor that we didn't get to take advantage of.......but would be a great place to have a few drinks in the evening. Catalin (I hope I spelled it right) and Armando worked the front desk most of our stay and were always willing to help us with our questions and wishes. this was overall a GREAT STAY with a SUPERB STAFF and CONVENIENT LOCATION. I would recommend this hotel for anybody who's going to be staying in the Rome area

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Candace W
Reviews.Content: This was our first time abroad and our first night in Italy! The hotel is in a lovely residential neighborhood and is old, yes, but very charming. The staff, especially Catalin and Armando, were very helpful and cheerful. The room and bathroom were larger than we had expected after reading how tiny the rooms are in Europe. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean, the A/C worked fine and we could even open the large floor to ceiling windows for fresh air. There was a great place to eat a block away and we always came back to the neighborhood for dinner and just to sit and watch the people go by while enjoying a wonderful glass of wine. There is a bus stop right in front of the hotel but it is also within walking distance of most everything. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Turner Very Very good value...”
Reviews.Author: jyh99
Reviews.Content: Hotel Turner was very good. I loved it. Nice check in, shabby elevator but ok. Wonderful rooms, i felt like a king. Reception kind and friendly, brekfast was good, free internet. We came here when they were having promotions (1 night off!! :) Anyhow GREAT PLACE ****

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: linda1183
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Turner for the last 2 nights of our honeymoon and we're pretty sorry we did. The room was absolutely tiny with twin beds, and when we requested the double we had booked they made a big production of going and finding our email in order to verify that we didn't in fact book a twin. Bathroom was the smallest of any hotel, b&b or even hostel that I have ever stayed in, my husband found it very hard to even get into the shower, and had to step over the toilet to get into it. Room was very noisy, widow opened onto a light well with a generator in it. Breakfast was atrocious, and if you wanted anything other than bad instant coffee there was a €2 charge! In a "4-star" hotel, with the prices you are paying for those rooms I would expect at least the offer of a cappuccino with my breakfast. But all this we would have gotten over if it wasn't for the unpleasantness of the staff, when we first arrived to check in the gentleman at the desk was arguing with another guest, then when he did stop to serve us his only words of greeting were "you know you have to pay €3 per person per night room tax, we are a 4-star hotel", which he finished up by answering the phone to argue with someone else! Than the lady who showed us to our room (the same one who didn't believe we had asked for a double on our honeymoon) managed to argue with another guest on the way! All in all, it wasn't a terrible hotel room or location wise, but I think you shouldn't be allowed to advertise as 4-star unless ALL rooms are up to that standard, and if they aren't the price should really reflect this.

Reviews.Title: “Turner Hotel, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 11 for a 4 day break. The room was very noisy due to the air con and a noise from a generator outside. We had a twin room and the beds were tiny. The bathroom was minute. The shower was so small I kept bumping into the toilet everytime I got out of it. It was very old fashioned too. That said the hotel had a strange charm to it, some of the decor is grossly outdated but then there is lots of beautiful marble inside the hotel bar and dining room. The staff were friendly and the furniture in the hotel room was lovely. Not massively centrally located but good bus links and in a very quiet area. The breakfast was dire, the bacon and eggs were heated by candle and were luke warm and sloppy. Pastries were stale and the coffee very watery. In fact i'm not sure it could legitimately be called coffee. This hotel is not worth more than £30 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Brenda_HutchinsonKS
Reviews.Content: Hotel Turner is a wonderful hotel! Very good location, the bus stop is right outside the door-very convenient. The staff was super! Namely Catalin, they went out of their way to assist us with anything. The breakfast was an awesome way to start your day, the room was charming, very clean, and the housekeeping dept. was top notch, AND we always had hot water! We definitely would stay there again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a four star, more like a two”
Reviews.Author: Kerrymes
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel turner for the style of the decoration and it I'd say that was the only thing it didn't let itself down on. We arrived midday so it was extremely warm and shown to a room with a toilet that didn't work along with the air-conditioning. The window looked out onto the back if other rooms and the air-conditioning units, awful. I refused to stay in the room and after being shown 5 others of equally poor standard we were finally given one on the other side of the hotel with a lovely big window over looking the street. This was much cooler and bigger and I was more than happy. Although our fridge was pretty much useless. Our bathroom was ok but the shower head leaked and it had taps that looked like they were in need of a bit of bleach! The hotel staff were very helpful with giving us directions around Rome and most of them were very friendly. Breakfast was pretty average and a few times we were sat waiting for more food to be brought out. Luckily we didn't pay a lot for our stay compared to other hotels in Rome or else I would have been complaining a lot more. Overall it was ok but I certainly won't be returning or recommending the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Erik B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in april/may. At first we got this tiny room, but we got a free upgrade, and thats good service if you ask me. The rooms are good enough to sleep in. Had to take the bus to get into centre but that took like 10 min max, so no problem here either. The reception people are nice and helpful, they actually got me on priority list at Hard Rock Cafe Rome by telling a little story to HRC Rome. A huge plus, and a funny story you'll never forget:) Price for the hotel was very good, we booked it only 2 weeks before we went and it was like 1/2 price of similar hotels around rome.

Reviews.Title: “Really Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iBlench
Reviews.Content: The number of incidents over the course of our three nights stay left us angry and disappointed. Upon arriving at Hotel Turner we were met by rude and unhelpful reception staff. We were shown to our superior double room (two beds pushed together) with a third single bed at the end. The room was shabby with bits of chandelier missing, worn furniture and musty smelling bedsheets. We discovered that the air conditioning did not work. We went to reception to report this and found that this was apparently an issue for the entire hotel and weren't offered any solutions to cool the room. We asked for fans which apparenlty the hotel didn't have. We were left hot and uncomfortable throughout our stay. Opening a window cooled it slightly but provided us with the noise of the busy road outside. On our second night we were woken in the early hours of the morning by a storm and a dripping noise from inside the room. I stepped in a pool of water and discovered that the dripping noise was in fact just part of the water that had been pouring into the room from beneath the closed window. We went to reception at around 4:00 am and told the receptionist. Apparently this had happened to the room next door too. He provided us with sheets to clear the water and left us to soak up the water still pouring into the room ourselves. The receptionist did not apologise. The third and final night of our stay we returned to our room to find that toiletries that we had bought and were still full had been removed from the shower, which hadn’t been cleaned. I reported this to the reception staff and management who sent a porter to look for the items that had been taken. Nothing was found and the items were not compensated for. On checking out the receptionist walked off whilst I was talking and went off to deal with other guests and answer telephone calls rather than try and deal with my complaint. I do not feel that this hotel meets the standard to be advertised as a four star hotel. Overall, the experience we had was appalling. We weren’t given an apology at anytime and no concern whatsoever was shown to the condition of the room and the standard of service we received.

Reviews.Title: “How to Cool Yourself Without Air Conditioning?”
Reviews.Author: maghnia13
Reviews.Content: I have booked for my engagement night hotel Turner in Rome for two romantic nights. When I reserved the hotel on lastminute.com the room was advertise quiet and romantic with air-conditioning. This Hotel is not quiet its by a busy road and dated, do not trust the pictures... Once we checked in we spend some time at the reception but we were not told anything about the air-conditioning not working. We arrived on the 5th floor to check the boiling hot room the porter told us the air-conditioning is very slow today 5minutes later confess its not working since yesterday... We went back to the reception, the receptionist explained to us it is not her fault if the air-conditioning is broken we should understand. Then she told us to put a fan in the room, we were by now quiet shocked by her answers. I asked to speak to the manager the answer was the manager never work on Sunday. This was a £200/night hotel 4stars. We wrote a letter to the manager on the day to explain we could not sleep in a hotel room facing a busy road during hot weather 34 degrees Celsius. I just came back home I realized they charged me for a two nights stay. I had to share my ridiculous journey with you.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Winter_au
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Superior" room, which means you get marble in the bathroom. The room was small, the window opened to the interior of the hotel so no natural light or breeze, the floor was gouged out in places and the tap in the sink sprayed water everywhere. Worst of all the air conditioning didn't work so it was hot and stuffy. We asked the staff about the AC but they weren't interested. After much complaining they allowed us to switch rooms (extremely rude staff through the whole process). The next room was a normal room, but was bigger and the window opened onto the street so there was light and a breeze. Turns out the AC was out in the whole hotel, so no luck there. The sink was ok, but there was no toilet paper holder and the shower didn't drain properly. To top it off, our last night it rained and the window seal was bad so water flooded the room. Worst hotel I can remember staying in. The staff were rude and unhelpful and the location sucks. Definetely not 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Objective_Babe
Reviews.Content: A good hotel if you want to stay very closer to the buzz of Central Rome. From the front of the hotel many buses go to various attractions. The staff are helpful, hotel is clean and I will stay there again. Tip: Walk left on leaving the hotel's front door one morning, down the road is a lovely green park with nice waterfalls, wooden bridge (similar to one painted by Monet – Water lilies) and a good place to read books.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Turner is a special Place”
Reviews.Author: Darnmavin1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Turner and I couldn't praise this hotel and their wonderful staff enough. Every single employee in the hotel were friendly and had an amazing service minded attitude towards the guests. Staff treated me and my spouse as though we were celebrities. The rooms are quiet, spacious and immaculately presented.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: paul t
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel. I'd like to write this two words to let you know my experience in Rome. I came back in Rome after 20 yrs and got a 15day holiday there. Let's start: I wrote several emails, just to check my details and avoid problems during my stay. I phoned and write email to check my booking and there was a gentle guy answering me the phone and giving me my sureness I'll have a nice experience, he organised me everything and I apreciated their Transfers & Tours Services (organised at the reception). When I arrive the same guy of the phone Welcome us, saying (for the first time in a hotel) my name: "Welcome, Mr. Paul" which I really appreciated. Easy and good managed check-in. The Smiley guy - bell boy escorted me to my room and shown us everything we wanted to know. The room was incredible stylish and ready to relax us. Big marble bathroom, a good bed and a lot of space. Went to the reception and got the free wifi (saved us a lot of time) and loved this free service. The lobby was perfect for a time dedicated to a newspaper of watching television with the nice old man, everyday staying there, probably was the owner. Days by days, good breakfast. I never tried the Room Service there, but I know people got to the reception and saying it was ok. The guy at the reception, Catalin, was so useful and so kind with us all the time. He organised us a sort of "day-live-something-to-do" and appreciated his help suggesting good restaurants, good tours, good info about the city and of course the speech about more or less. He's prepared and get to succeed. He was charming with everyone, smiling all the time and full of positive energy. Our 15 days flew away and the last night went to check out our bill there. Guess who was on a service? The charming guy! He let us know everything and he wished me a nice last night in Rome. The day after a Black Mercedes got us to the airport (transfer service) and completed my half-month holiday... HAPPY! A good satifaction and a good hotel, full of Human Power. Thanks to the staff, Catalin and the others, we had a very good time! Hotel should invest more on people there, people like the reception guys! WE DO SUGGEST THIS HOTEL. CHOOSE IT AND RELAX! ... IN ROME!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, let down by some rude staff”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTravellers22
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay here during August 2011. We extremely impressed by the rooms and hotel which had an old Italian look with amazing antique furniture in the room and beautiful statutes in lobby. The breakfast was simple but tasty, however was not staffed well. There was constantly empty plates at the buffet (which isn't big so that doesn't leave much food!). The rooms were beautiful and the bathroom was quite big for Italy. The location was great as even though it's about a ten minute drive to all the amazing sights of Rome, there is a bus just outside the hotel that goes to all the main sights bar the Colloseum. Bus 62. Our issue here was the reception staff - and not all, as our last night there was the most charming and friendly gentleman working reception. Although all other receptionists we encountered were extremely cold and short. The one that checked us in was VERY rude and practically threw the key on the reception desk and said the porter will show you your room. We were never told anything, no intro, nothing. We had to ask the porter what time/floor breakfast was in, how to get around, whereabouts the hotel is on a Rome map. So we didn't have a great welcome. And then our jacuzzi in the room wasn't working but the receptionist didn't seem to care as we rung to get someone to look at it and it took three phone calls and over an hour and a half of waiting before anyone came up. They said it was broken and a technician had to look at it. They said check with them in the morning. We did and the same receptionist was on, he laughed and said, it's broken there is nothing we can do. I then wanted a discount on our stay because we booked a superior room - he said there was no way as we booked not directly through the hotel but said to check back the next day. We did and he shrugged us off. If it wasn't for this one receptionist we would have had a much better stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Turner”
Reviews.Author: sallyd14
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 night break at the Hotel Turner, stayed with husband and 3 children, we shared a superior room, which was great. Reception were very friendly, breakfast was fine, air con could have been better but it was 43c outside and the building was very old, buses were very frequent, used Roma Pass for the adults and the children had photo copies of their EU Passports so no problems with queues , had a great time, lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nishi c
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Would definitely stay here again. The room exceeded my expectations.. they were clean, really spacious and very comfortable! Many many thanks to all the staff who made this such a memorable, unforgettable stay. We expect to return as soon as we can. What more could you ask for??

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & great nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: CacaMck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner for 4 nights in mid August. We had a very satisfactory double superior room and had a great sleep every night - the bed was big and comfortable and the blackout curtains were really effective. We were in 532 and despite facing the main road the room was quiet when the window was closed. The air conditioning seemed to work really well - it was 35 C every day but always cool on the 5th floor and although you did not seem to be able to control it from your room it seemed to be set to a comfortable level and there was no noise. We had a jacuzzi shower, no bath but that was fine with us. The staff were always courteous and helpful. Although this hotel is a little bit out from the historic centre there is a bus stop right outside and public transport in Rome is excellent and cheap - you can get buses all day and night, night bus number 4 goes by the hotel every 20 minutes all night Breakfast was fine,and served up until 10am. It was a shame the rooftop bar was closed for refurbishment during our stay, so I don't know what the drinks were like..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: TATMA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location with the bus stop just outside the door. Bus 62 passes every 20 minutes and is the bus that takes you to the main sites (piazza venezia , fontana di Trevi, spanish steps etc.) The buses run till midnight and then there is the night bus No 4 which passes every 30 minutes after midnight and again stops opposite the hotel. There are a number of trattorias just two streets parallel to the hotel which are very reasonably priced. We went to Trattoria pizza napoli and it was very good value. For 12 Euro we had bruschetta, pasta and a soft drink. Drinks here were cheaper ( Euro 3) than central rome where a soft drink is 5 euro. There were a number of other restaurants which looked very appealing. We took 3 rooms for our stay. A suite and 2 deluxe rooms. Room 532 (double superior) was the best. The furniture in all three rooms is exquisite (antique furniture / damask curtains / chandeliers etc) marble floors etc. The bathroom is on the small side and has a shower with an incorporating jacuzzi. Room 530 is just as nice but slightly smaller than room 532. The staff was great and they also gave us a complimentary champagne in the room given that our brother had his 40th birthday. Breakfast is good and includes cereals, salamis, cheese, scrambled eggs bacon, yogourt and a vast choice of pastries and cakes. The decor of the hotel is extremely nice. The hotel website offers some great offers so best to check this before you book through another site. For 3 nights we only paid 250 euro for a double superior room. Staff was very willing to help with information and was extremely curteous. Arianna was great. The hotel also has a rooftop bar which is open till midnight and even later - which is perfect for a night drink. The only negative apect of this stay was in respect of the junior suite - room 506 which had a faulty airconditioner and it was a nightmare to sleep at night because during the night it seems that the airconditioners are turned lower. Overall a wonderful holiday and would definitely return to hotel turner - however I will just make sure before hand that the airconditioner is working. A recommendable hotel. Another good restaurant was Il Picchio just near Fontana Di Trevi - good value/ airconditoned and friendly service. For transfer to airport we chose romepickup which had very good rates.

Reviews.Title: “Choose this Hotel at your peril!!”
Reviews.Author: Guerdner
Reviews.Content: My simple advice is "Dont choose this establishment or you risk spoiling a trip that you are about to pay good money for" Location: Average to poor unless u need to be near Terminii Dont believe the reviews you see posted. (Cant understand how anyone could have enjoyed this hotel) The cleanliness of the hotel rooms is appawling. Air Conditioning does not work Internet only works in parts of the hotel. I met some nice Austilian people in the rooftop bar on my first night and some of their experiences during their 4 day stay could not be repeated. Trust me move on to the next hotel on your list. Dont even think about Hotel Turner Rome.

Reviews.Title: “There are many hotels in Rome - no reason to choose this”
Reviews.Author: travellor022
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at Turner Hotel. A summing up would look like this: - Friendly reception on arrival, help with the luggage - Room too hot and stuffy. Air condition not working properly. Complaints resultet in attempts to solve the problem, including a portable fan. Complaints to the reception ended in that they gave us a bigger, better and more airy room (even though the shower leaked over most of the bathroom floor) . - We suspect they turn down the air condision during the night: we woke up soking in sweat and had to apply our tropical trick; Cover yourself with wet towels and hope to fall asleep before they are dry. - No bread on the breakfast buffet one of the days, and very little else (and the pastry not that fresh) - No access to internet for a whole day, and I was sent on a wild goose chase in the area where the man in the reception said there were web facilities - which turned out not to exist. Their last suggestion was to look in the arfes around Termini which I did not do. Bus stop right outside hotel entrance very useful. Staff was friendly, appolgizing, but this is not what you expect from a hotel boasting four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: katerina_ktl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 days during our trip to Rome and we have only good things to remember.Firstly the reception staff was very friendly and helpfull and spoke english fluently.The room was splendid(we got superior room).The bath was a bit small but the jacuzzi was definately a pleasure after a tiring day sightseeing.Breakfast was good.The location was excellent(5 minutes from metro station castro pretorio and bus stop exactly opposite the hotel).Bus 90 and nightbus 4(after 00:00) costed just 1 euro and were frequent enough and could transport you everywere.Nice cheap restaurants nearby.Some improvements need to be made to the hotel in order to be perfect.We strongly recommend this to everyone!:-)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is average but good location”
Reviews.Author: fluffysheepWales
Reviews.Content: Location: Good, we walked to the hotel from Termini station in the day and it took us about twenty minutes, so as long as you have a good map it is easy to find although I wouldn't have attempted the walk in the night. There is a bus stop outside the hotel which will take you to all the main attractions. The hotel is close to (10-15 min walk) the area of Barberini and Via veneto which is quite busy and has some nice bars and restaurants. We also walked to Trevi fountain which took around twenty minutes. Hotel/Rooms: On first impressions the hotel looks very smart and elegant, the reception area is very nice and also the breakfast room. The room was fine and quite big however some of the fixtures and fittings are looking tired and worn. We only had one door on the shower and the air conditioning did not work. I would not rate this hotel as a 4 star, although I think it has the potential if it was updated. Staff at hotel: Most of the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and spoke good english, on arrival they gave us a map of the city and showed which bus to catch to get to the main attractions and this was very helpful. Breakfast: The buffet breakfast is what you would expect from a European hotel. There was a choice of cooked eggs and bacon, cold meats and cheese, toast, cereal and a large variety of pastries. It was pretty much all you needed to start your day off. Rome itself: Rome is a very beautiful city and I would highly reccomend seeing it. It is a very large city and not all the main attractions are close to each other so it will require you to use public transport to get around, hence why I said this hotel is in a good location, because it has good transport links.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bunky415
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel Turner in Rome. So much so, that we ended up staying there again on our last night in Rome, after having travelled throughout Tuscany. The hotel is very pretty, clean, in a great location, with a great staff. The staff were particularly helpful in making dinner reservations for us, helping us navigate public transportation, and making sure we were having a good stay. the bed was very comfortable, and despite being on a busy street, the windows are double-paned it it was very quiet. I would stay here again, and recommend it to anyone who asks!

Reviews.Title: “WARNING - I think they tried to scam me!”
Reviews.Author: Dommey
Reviews.Content: I decided to book a junior suite at the Turner Hotel for my wife's Birthday trip. On arriving at the hotel we were shown to our room which looked "cosy" at the least. A query at reception assured me I was in a junior suite, I thought this looked strange but put it down to the rooms always look bigger in the pictures. After 1 night of shuffling around the bed, I looked at the hotel's website to find if we did indeed have the right room. The suite on the website did look spacious to say the least and I checked my booking to make sure I had booked the right room, which I had. Imagine my surprise when I checked to see what a regular room looks like and was greeted with pictures of my very own room, with the same detailed green wallpaper and oriental wardrobe. I immediately showed the pictures to the manager on duty that had given us our room. He first informed me that the pictures were of a standard room. When I told him that the pictures were of my room and that I had actually booked a suite, he said that I actually did have a suite and the pictures were wrong on the internet and needed updating. He then proceeded to explain that the hotel was being refurbished and my room had not been done yet, I failed to see how a decoration would make the room bigger. He said I would have to speak to the hotel manager who would not be in the next day. The kick in the teeth came the next morning when on the way to breakfast I walked past another room that was vacant , but the door left open to air the room. I "peeked" in to find a room to the proportions I thought I had booked. I immediately grabbed my camera and took photos of the empty room and my room. I showed the photos to the same manager who said I was in the right room and that I would have to speak to the hotel manager who was in the next day. At this point I did not know if I was losing my mind or if this was some sort of scam thought up by the Sopranos! I went on the website and took photos of the pages that described the rooms (even square metres), along with these I took the pictures of the 2 rooms and my booking voucher to a second manager. I explained I would be taping the conversation on my phone and showed all the evidence for the prosecution. After 10 Mins the manager said I was in the wrong room. Hooray! Their first solution was to move me to a suite, not that night, but the following night. This was our last night and I was not about to move all of our baggage for 1 night. They also did not mention anything about the money I had paid for a suite but only received a standard room. I refused to move until this was sorted. The mysterious hotel manager was phoned. He would refund the difference of the 2 rooms and no more. I only think he did this after Last Minute.com was mentioned. If I had booked directly I think he would have told me to take a walk. I eventually received some money back. My thought was that if I had said nothing, this would have gone unnoticed. I am not sure whether they did it on purpose, but they tried to disguise the fact for 3 days. On the final day, I saw the manager who had booked us in and given our room. He was still unapolagetic and said there was a problem with the computer (along with the internet pictures and undecorated room). As standard rooms go, it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “dont believe the bad reviews - great value hotel if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: LucyT13
Reviews.Content: we got hotel turner at a great price on lastminute.com, but after reading all the bad reviews i was worried it might be a mistake. Luckily we found it to be a very pleasant hotel, our room was lovely and was as you expected from the website pictures, the breakfast was great unless you are someone who wants a cooked breakfast, we were quite happy with fruit, toast, yogurts pastries and cold meats and when you see the cost of food in restaurants in central Rome you really realise the importance of having breakfast included...the service at the hotel was excellent, the lightbulb above the shower blew and meant you could see nothing in there, the staff had someone sent up to fix it in literally minutes. They also were always happy to help in recommending restaurants, the right bus service etc - and the bus stop being right outside was another plus. Overall we had a great stay and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants good value but good service as well.

Reviews.Title: “Run while you still can”
Reviews.Author: Garybron
Reviews.Content: Wow.. where do i start... Upon our arrival we approached the reception desk where the did not even look up to acknowledge our arrival until we tapped on the desk and said hello. He greeted us as though he was doing us a favour - a smile was too much to ask for. We were then taken to our room and upon entering we were struck by the pungent smell of what smelt like oven smoke because our windows had been left completely open during the lunch preparations. I inquired with the receptionist about being moved to another room but was told that the smell would go away eventually and we were to keep the windows closed. The furniture in the room was completely outdated and the linen had a particularly disturbing odour to it. The television had one channel in english; a news channel which is constantly on loop and is surprising for a hotel which claims to be fully international. The water tempreture in the mornings was luke warm at best and the shower did not work properly. The breakfast was average at best and actually not worth getting out of bed for as the coffee was luke warm and the pastries not fresh. this hotel is definitely not four star quality and I would strongly advise against choosing it for your stay, you will most certainly regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilandLee
Reviews.Content: Rome was our first stop on our honeymoon for 3 nights. We thought our superior double room was great - big ornate mirrors and headboard, replete with gold flocked wallpaper and a marble bathroom. Small attention to detail was a bit lacking - the flowers in the room were almost dead, tea and coffee wasn't refilled even after asking. Breakfast was fine and plenty of it and the staff friendly. There was no view to speak of from the room (we weren't expecting one but just in case you are) as the windows faced inward which meant it was lovely and quiet. Slightly annoying was that the double bed was made up of two single mattresses which wouldn't stay together. The hotel is a lovely romantic place to stay but I was glad that we got the room on offer from Lastminute.com as I think I would have been a little disappointed had we have paid full price. I imagine the more expensive rooms are fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marylou_cahill
Reviews.Content: , we are just back from a very pleasant stay in hotel turner, a present from our daughters. Before going,we looked up tripadvisor to get some feed back on the hotel. we were a bit apprehensive after reading some reports,but we must have gone to a different hotel than the rest of the people. Our room no 124, was on the first floor. It was very clean,a,good size for a room in rome, and was decorated recently. the staff were pleasant and helpful and breakfast was the normal continental one.This was our fourth time in Rome,but first in the turner hotel,and we would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good at saying sorry !”
Reviews.Author: Topsy50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel supposedly for a romantic weekend. Arriving late on Thursday evening we were shown to our room. Imagine our disappointment when having booked a double room we were met with a very small room with two single beds. Immediately we went to the reception and requested that we be provided with the double room that we had paid for and requested. The lady could not be more apologetic but could not provide the room and said it would be sorted out in the morning. Giving her the benefit of the doubt and the late hour of the day we accepted the room. The following morning, once again we had cause to complain that the shower in the room was broken and that the safe was not working. Once again we were told it would be sorted out and we set off for our sightseeing tours. Arriving back at the hotel late afternoon, the only thing that had been done was that the beds had been pushed together. Again we complained, again they apologized, this time sending someone up to the room to take a look. More apologies and again promises that it would be sorted out the following day. You've guessed it ! More apologies !!! I have no doubt that as we were only staying three nights that they had absolutely no intention of sorting anything out. The pictures of the hotel are taken in such a way that the hotel appears much more spacious and splendid than it actually is. My summary, yes they are polished in saying sorry but don't expect anything other than apologies and certainly don't expect any resolutions ! Tip ..... Stay elsewhere !

Reviews.Title: “Not what you think”
Reviews.Author: Davey55
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Turner last week. On arrival the hotel look nice from the outside, as going into the reception I was impressed with the reception area. We had our bags taken into the room, the room was nice but the view of a wall outside was disappointing, bathroom was basic, shower was okay but needs upgrading, towels and bed linen was changed on time, instructions for safe were wrong and the lady at the reception had no idea if we needed a key or not. On day 3 of our stay we asked the barman for two cappuccinos but he said he was too busy, there was no one else at the bar at the time, it was lazy and damn right rude. There are two lifts in the building which they fail to tell you. One lift goes up but sometimes doesn't come down. They don't seem to tell you much at this hotel and it's like they are not bothered if your there or not. There is breakfast but no meals there, we thought they missing out on a big trick. Don't bother drinking in the bar because the drinks are a rip off!!!! Some of the reception staff are rude and moody. Do not ask the staff to order a taxi for you as they are a rip off, they give you a code to give to the taxi man but most of the time they are not bothered for that information. One taxi charged 15 Euro for going 5 mile and the taxi fair was at 8 Euro befre we even set off, for a hotel to ring up a taxi firm like this and have them on their books is just poor. We told reception when we got back and they didn't really care. They give you free internet use but the the internet is so slow it's not even worth using. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Ruth_1608
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relatively well situated, its easy to get to from termini and you can walk or get the bus to all of the tourist areas. The area where it is located is reasoably nice and there are some nice restaurants and bars near by. When we checked in to the hotel we were shwon to a room that was very tired and in desperate need of renovation, for example the fabric walls were torn and very dirty. My partner (who would never normally complain) asked the staff if we could change rooms as it was not what we expected. The staff were very nice and showed us to a new room. This room was much nicer and more what we expected. This room was clean and functional, the beds were comfortable and though we were on the ground floor it was very quiet. Overall this isn't a hotel I would choose to stay in again, however it serves as a decent base and given how expensive Rome hotels can be it isn't bad value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: dizzydot
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome to celebrate my husbands birthday, we chose the hotel because it looked beautiful in the pictures. I emailed the hotel before hand asking for a nice room with a nice view as we were coming to celebrate my husbands birthday, I got a response to my email fairly quickly, I was told that we would be given a nice room with a nice view but I could upgrade to a better room at a price, as we were on a budget we decided to stay in our standard room. When we arrived what a disappointment, the reception staff were not welcoming at all, they never even showed us where the dining room was or told us when breakfast was, We were shown to our room, disappointment number 2, the room was gloomy, small, the paint was flaking off the ceiling, infact there was a big flake of paint on the bedside table which stayed there the whole 4 nights we were at the hotel. What a shock when we looked out the window, we were greeted with the pipe from the aircon. There was a minibar set in a cupboard which was badly damaged, the bathroom was also tiny and cramped. There was mould in the corners of the shower. If this was one of the better standard rooms I would hate to see the worse. We expected to be staying in a 4 star hotel not a 2 star. When we went to breakfast on our first morning we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to the other dining room for 5 euros, as I said before we were on a budget so we decided to stay put, Good thing we did as de soon found out you can have food from both dining rooms, paying extra just meant that you sat in a brighter room. On the plus side the hotel is not in the centre so restaurant prices are cheaper and there are quite a few around the hotel, also there is a bus stop right outside the hotel which makes getting to the sites really easy. On leaving the hotel we didn't even get a goodbye. So thank you Turner Hotel for spoiling my husbands birthday. Would we stary there again, not a chance, would we recommend this hotel, not a chance. Take our advice if you are on a budget do not stay in this hotel you will get a nicer 3 star for what we paid for this break.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth its 4 stars - disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jandkWestMids
Reviews.Content: After seeing the pictures on the hotels website, we believed that we were staying in a very opulent hotel and very much looking forward to staying there. On arrival to the hotel we went to the reception and didn't get a hello - how are you -how can I help you. Instead we just got "Passports please" then just got given our room key, they didn't explain where breakfast was served, I had to ask when we could have our passports back and no "have a nice stay" etc, so our first impressions were not good to say the least. We were on the 3rd floor and as we walked to the room we noticed the light fittings with wires sticking out from them all over the place and wires where there must have been a light fitting previously just protruding from the wall.The bedroom was ok, but there was a half empty can of cola in the fridge so that had not been checked properly and the little lamp shelf by my bed was covered in dust and remained like that for the 4 nights we were there. I always judge a hotel on its bathroom!! and in this hotel it was not good. It was clean enough but the shower was a tiny little square up the corner with a shower curtain that had cable ties for curtain rings and due to the smallness of the shower the curtain attacked you as you showered!! On a more positive note, the location was fab, there is a bus stop outside the hotel where you can get buses to most of the major attractions in Rome and the breakfast was good. If you read my other reviews you will see I do not moan about hotels usually, especially as when you are holiday you aren't in them much, but I had high expectations of this hotel and was greatly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not a lot going for it...”
Reviews.Author: KateLGib
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay at Hotel Turner. When we checked in we were given a standard double room which was quite dissapointing for a 4 star hotel. It was dark and dingy and very small. Once inside the bathroom it was clear that my husband (who is of average build but quite tall) could barely fit inside the shower. With no bath, and therefore no alternative for washing this was clearly a problem. I went to the reception desk to ask if they had a different room and I was met with lots of sighing and frankly lots of barriers. My husband came out ot see if I was OK as this had been going on for some time. In the end the receptionist offered us a more superior room but wanted to charge us an extra 20 Euros per night. Obviously we were quite taken aback by that so she offered it at 15 Euros per night. Now, I understand that the hotel has rooms of various standards but surely even the most basic of rooms need to be fit for use. She tried to tell me that all showers in Italy were that size which we know from experience is a complete lie. After much huffing and puffing and throwing of hands in the air (on her part not ours!) she gave us this room free of charge which turned out to be a comfortable stay. However it put me ill at ease for the beginning of our stay there. The hotel is situated quite a way out of the city which proved to be a bit of a pain when getting around. Breakfast seemed ot be divided into Continental and Full. When we booked through an agent we just had the option of bed and breakfast but were quite surprised to find that we only had the continental which consisted of juice, cereals and pasteries (quite limited) Also, be warned...Rome has added a tax on overnight accommodation in the city which is not included if you book through an outside website. For this hotel it was 3 Euros per night per person. Felt like a kick in the teeth after our less than warm welcome at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrikey
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Superior Double at Hotel Turner for 4 nights over Easter. Pros: - The breakfast is excellent and a great start to each day. Cold meats/cheese/pastries etc are on offer. - Free, fast wifi - Rooms were cleaned very well every day - Hotel itself is grand in a quirky way - I liked the styling. Some may call it outdated but I think it's a matter of preference. - They've just opened up a bar - the bar area is nice, as are the bar staff - Staff were helpful in booking excursions/taxis. Some tourists may take their stiffness to be rudeness but I don't think this is the case. Don't expect smiles and all the other 'bells and whistles' but the staff are always willing to help when asked. Cons - No room service - bit of a shame when you're feeling hungry in the middle of the night - The rooms are quite small, to the extent that I questioned the concierge as to whether I had been given the superior double I had booked. Expect to feel squashed in the shower unless you are very petite. - The roof terrace has great potential but needs to be updated with some new furniture. Currently it is fitted with plastic deck chairs etc. It offers a great view of the sunrise and would also be a nice place to relax in the evening, so would be good if they fitted it out. - We took minicabs everywhere so location wasn't that much of an issue. We could get pretty much anywhere for 10EUR. But if you like to walk to all the large attractions, you may prefer somewhere more central. In summary, it's adequate for the price but when I revisit Rome I will probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: millieIsleofWight
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Turner. We asked for a room not facing the street and were given a very quiet room which is a priority! Some minor renovations were going on on fourth floor but this was not a problem. Reception staff were reasonably helpful with information and we booked ahead for the Vatican via the hotel computer. The bus stops were just up the road from the hotel and some nice nearby restaurants. A word of warning, we tried to visit the Borghese Gallery but disappointed it was booked a week ahead. We were pleased it was culture week so got free entry to many places. Rome is a magnificent place and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap yes - luxurious it is not”
Reviews.Author: SwissMiss47
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed given previous TripAdvisory comments. It's convenient only for the Villa Borgese, and not in a particularly nice area. Reception chaotic though helpful, rooms small, and generally in major need of a refurbishment. If price is your only consideration then OK, if ambience is a criteria then not.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, unkept, dated. Bathroom disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: mandy186411
Reviews.Content: We treated our family to a weekend in Rome as part of their Christmas present. The Hotel Turner looked fabulous on their website. However it was dirty. The bathroom we had in one room had tiles chipped off and the taps and facilities were rusty. It was a real trap for germs. The whole hotel except the reception area was outdated and tired. The air conditioning did not work and when the porter came to fix it we were told not to move it too much in case it went off again! Do not stay in this hotel you will be very disappointed. Photos attached.

Reviews.Title: “Not to recommend....”
Reviews.Author: Bertha97
