Reviews.Content: You do not get what you reserve, it is not clean and they are not very friendly!! A smile would have helped a lot......

Reviews.Title: “Pure Unadulterated Value Ror Money”
Reviews.Author: nicola55021
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have recently returned from our week in Rome, staying at Hotel Turner. We got an internet price o f65 euros per night for a twin room with breakfast. As this is cheap for Rome I was a little apprehensive as B and B's were pricier. How could a four star hotel be this price? Beautifully decorated hotel, marble bathroom, extremely comfortable beds with beautiful linens and a full breakfast instead of the basic continental we expected. Ariane, on the front desk could not have been more helpful, booking tickets for us ,advising us on museums, discussing Roman history - even telling us where to find a shop selling their own homemade pasta dishes for us to bring home. This hotel is absolute value for money, two stops by bus from the colosseum. I intend to return to Rome again this year, so much more I want to see and I wouldnt stay anywhere else. A pleasure. Nicola Kerr

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DaniM83
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day stay at the Turner. The rooms are great, spacious and porvide a kind of Roman feel to them. Unless this is how you have designed your own home staying in one of these rooms can be a great experience in it's self, Addtionally the room was very clean and a pleasure to come home to after a hard day sight seeing. We also booked breakfast for our stay and again this exceeded expectations. All staff were friendly and provided help on the local areas when required, special thanks to the guys who served breakfast, they were always friendly and happy to help if we had questions. The other massive plus point for us was the hotels location. Its a very short journey from the main sights via a bus but is just far enough away from the central tourest area that you will not get ripped off for food at its local resturants and bars that tend to be better quality and get Italian customers. For exmaple: near the hotel my girlfriend and my self had drinks, a main and desert each which in total cost 36 euros. On our last day we decided to have lunch bang in the center of town and was charged 10 euros for each glass of coke (i know, carzy !) and silly money for a very small snack, total 60 euros. I will be returning to Rome and will be returning to the Turner. If you want a well presented hotel at a resohnable price, with good customer service, well designed rooms ( including a great bath shower), and a location that is just right (only 5 mins on 1 bus directly out side the hotel to the main strip, via del corso) then this is the place for you. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: xj_me_leex
Reviews.Content: Beware- this hotel has two completely different sides to it. An old shabby side and a new recently refurbished side. I booked the hotel for a weekend away with my boyfriend in early march. As a 4 star at around 200euros for two nights we expected something decent. Once arriving we were taken to floor 4. The room was notging like i remembered seeing in the photos. It looked and felt dirty, old and dusty. The wallpaper was grey rather than cream as it was dirty and the bed covers were covered in stains. The bathroom was very old too. It seemed nothing at all like the hotel we had looked at pictures of and read reviews for. After complaining, we were moved to the otherside of the building to floor 5. After stepping out of the lift we were suprised that it was completely different, new, wooden floors. It was as if we were in a new hotel all together! The room was a lot nicer with a completely different bathroom, furiture, etc- just like we had seen in the photos. Considering there was no option when booking to choose from the new or old part, make sure you are not fobbed of with the smelly dirty old rooms. Our stay ended up being very nice. Bus stop just outside 10 mins into the very centre of rome ( trevi fountain, spanish steps, collosseum) staff not overly helpful but to be honest not many of the italians were at all- everyone just desperate for a tip! Also beware alot of the restaurants in rome have small print- * some food with asterix may be frozen. Frozen pizzas!! We were suprised to find this in the home of the pizza italy, worth paying a little extra for nicer restaurants. Another tip, when at the colloseum there is a huge huge que. To bypass this we joined an englosh tour which was around 7 eur more than the entrance fee but was so worth it as we went in immediately and then just left the tour and went off on our own. Overall we had a nice time and enjoyed rome but both said we wouldnt rush back.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: campbell_jamesn
Reviews.Content: charming hotel, great staff... the rooms may be small for some, but have an authentic feel to them

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with beautiful decor and lots of choice for breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Eddie11_11
Reviews.Content: Spent a good 5 days at hotel Turner; our room (520) was small but beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. Great shower in the (very Italian) marble en suite. There was plenty of choice at breakfast, which was available from 7 - 10 am. The staff were always friendly and helpful. We walked everywhere from the hotel and enjoyed exploring the side streets as well as all the main attractions, Found it really easy to navigate our way around just using the local tourist map. There are several different buses that leave from right outside the Hotel and the metro is not far away if you prefer not to walk.. It would be very helpful if there was more information in the room about the hotel, for example times of breakfast, computer facilities, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fabolous location”
Reviews.Author: woodsemily15
Reviews.Content: we had such great 5 days here,in turner hotel. it was a good location in porta pia. great and helpfull staff. beautifull room (room number 522 on fifth floor) our view was on nomentana street. we had a delightful pleasant. more confortable. thank you for a lovely stay. i hope to come again here....with my boyfriend...

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, beautiful elaborate decor- good location.”
Reviews.Author: RascalKing
Reviews.Content: Hotel Turner is a solid hotel. Nice interior. Staff is friendly. Breakfast buffet was decent. The downside: Rooms are nice but small. TV options are just basic cable, thus one English channel. Good location, though a tiny bit outside the main city/wall and no air conditioning so room was a tad hot. Booked the day before departure and paid 520 GBP for 3 nights including air on lastminute.com.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aslitsa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Turner is really beautiful.Rooms are very CLEAN and cozy. Staff was friendly..Reception can give you all the information you need to see Rome. Information: 1) Best way to go to the hotel from airport is the mini bus.it cost only 15euro. 2) If you want to go to the center from the hotel you can take bus 62.It's only 10minutes. Also 62 bus goes to Vatican.Bus 60 goes to Colosseo.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value fo a Very Good location in Historic area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: JoeBee2010
Reviews.Content: Good comfortable rooms and reasonable breakfast in very good location for access to historic areas of Rome. Hotel Desk staff were very helpful. Language difficulties kept breakfast waiters from understanding a preference for crispy bacon but guess hardly cooked bacon or ham slices is the Italian style. We didn't understand why there was a continuous bad smell coming from the bathroom; it was as though there was something bad being disinfected just beyond the bathroom vent. We had two non-adjacent rooms. Curiously, one day, neither room was made up. In fact, the tag to "Make up the room now", which was on one of the doors, was reversed to "Do Not Disturb" when we returned to the hotel. Hotel staff seemed as surprised as we were by this.

Reviews.Title: “very elegant and romantic hotel,good position and affordable”
Reviews.Author: sam-sweet
Reviews.Content: With my boyfriend we spent a really great week in this hotel at the beginning of January!it's located in a really quiet but central zone, really close to the city center that you can easily reach with bus or with a little walk. The rooms are really clean and elegant. It's a really romantic environment and the stuff is so kind and nice.The price is definitely worth.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Scouser-Boi
Reviews.Content: Stayed during Dec 2010 in suite room for 5 days. Unique decor and clean rooms and bathrooms. Staff very keen to help. Only downer was the lack of replenishment of teas and coffees in the room - but when asked then Reception sorted it - had to ask every day - you'd think they would stock every day? Also no milk or milk powder for teas and no instant coffee - only tea. Strange...minor issue though. Breakfast was ok - nothing special - standard Continental with lots of cake goodies - Scrambled egg and Bacon also on offer but often cold so not really exciting. In terms of location perfect for Termini Station. Bus 90, 62, 63 will get you to Turner Hotel (get off at Porta Pia stop) while Bus 90 and many others will get you to Termini (check the boards). 62 will get you to Colloseum. Bus stop right outside hotel and tickets available from machine - don't use notes though - I lost 10 Euro that way. 1 Euro will get you a Bus trip anywhere for 75min OR 1 Metro trip and then buses for 75min. Beware no shop or convenience store close to hotel that I could find - so for basic essentials you will need to stock once in town centre. Pharmacy outside hotel and great Chinese Restuarant 5 doors down. 34 Euros fed a family for 4 inc drinks. Fruit shop 1 block down - small but will be good enough. Overall really unique hotel - worth a stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Turner: A Jewel of a Hotel and Rome's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: GiuseppeSarSp
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Turner in Rome (Italy) is a jewel of a hotel. It is ideally located next to Porta Pia, within literally minutes to the historical center of Rome and yet situated in a popular Roman neighborhood known for its restaurants and shops. Easily reachable by public transportation at all hours of day and night, the Hotel Turner offers spotlessly clean and elegant rooms at very reasonable prices. The staff speaks several foreign languages, and is extremely helpful and willing to assist you with all your needs. For years I have stayed at this hotel for extensive periods, and it has always offered me the highest quality and service. Whether for business and/or pleasure, I strongly recommend Hotel Turner for your Roman sojourn. The eternal city offers more than a thousand of hotels, but Hotel Turner is Rome’s best kept secret. I have recommended it to my friends and colleagues and they have always thanked me for it. I have travelled throughout Italy and have stayed at numerous hotels, but I find Hotel Turner to be far superior to the others. Happily submitted by a frequent client, Giuseppe Faustini (NY)

Reviews.Title: “Cold and smell bad”
Reviews.Author: bezelye
Reviews.Content: Turner hotel is the worst choice while staying in Rome. In Rome weather was nice and sunny, but Hotel turner's room was so cold, I call the reception to arrange the A/C, they did not solve the problem,only send me 2 blanket. ...Whole room is red and classical furnitures,red walls, red bad, red chair, feel in bloody sunday. I asked the hotel to change my room because of cold, they said sorry madam. But the location is good, one bus is enough to reach Fontana di Trevi and for other locations, breakfast is normal. Hotel stuff is kind, but not nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection, what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: KeLsI_79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my friends. We found him fit for us because it was central and comfortable. We chose the rate with breakfast included and I must say that we made the right choice the first day we took room service because we were really tired the next day we ate in the Versailles room that I considered very elegant. The food was delicious. If I had to return to Rome, perhaps with my children, I'm sure I'll be back 'at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great friends vacation.”
Reviews.Author: katinatheodora
Reviews.Content: Hello. I stayed for a week in this hotel. I was part of a group of friends from Greece. I stayed in a nice single room. The room wasn't very big, but it was clean and light. They put fresh fruit every morning in the room after cleaning. The room was great, but it was right on the main street and it was noisy with the windows open, though it was silent with the windows closed. Air conditioning was working good in the room, air filters were clean(I sell A/C and i controlled :) don't judge me! :) it is only my job). They served only breakfast, although we had dinner once in the hotel. Breakfast had everything: italian and european breakfast. The hotel helped with our museum visits and organized outside of Rome trips for us too. They have good restaurant recommendations, also. The hotel has a good position, center of the city it's just minute away. We didn't use the public trasportation very often, but buses stop right in front of the hotel. The vacation was very beautiful, some of our group even went to meet with the pope; i chose to do something else, the pope isn't a religious figure for me. I visited the Vatican, and it is very impressive. Also check out the Trevi Fountain and off course the Collosseo and Piaza Venezia. Have great vacations in Rome everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: annaidptolomeo
Reviews.Content: In July we stayed in this hotel during a trip of 6 days. There were more than 40 people in our group. I brought my entire family, myself, my wife and our 3 children. Alex, our group leader, organized everything : the trip, the bus, the plane tichets and the hotel. The hotel Turner is in the centre of Rome, it has an antic glow. It is very classic, with marble everywhere, golden lights and everything. It seems like a french antique castle, my wife loved it very much. Our kids loved the free internet service in the lobby and room. The kids were not very impressed by the historical city of Rome, they cared more about facebook and stuff. Incredible! But let's go on. The staff members of the hotel were helpful and kind. The last evening of our last of our 6 days there, they even organized a dinner inside of the hotel for our group. It was a pleasant surprise for all of us. The hotel is clean and is well positioned. The bus they provided for the tours was quite new and the guide from the bus, Ilaria, was very kind, and made fun all the historical info she gave us. 1 day we visited, the Valmontone Shopping Outlet, that is outside of Rome, about 2 hours, but it was worth it: we bought lots of nice things on sale, my wife and kids bought beautiful designer clothes at 70 % or more discount. This was a great tip the hotel owner gave us. He told us that rome was in the middle of the SALES season, and suggested to go there. Great tip! We recommned this hotel to everyone. Grazie

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday! We even met the Pope.”
Reviews.Author: apapakis
Reviews.Content: Hello to everyone. My name is Alexander Papakis. I am from a small village in Greece, Peloponnese, called Kyparissi, near the seaside. Last month our church organized a trip to Rome, Italia. We were a group of 42 people. We went by bus to Athens and there, by plane to Rome. The people of Hotel Turner organized a very comfortable bus for us for our 6 days stay there. A guide was also provided. The bus waited for us at Fiumicino Leonardo da Vinci airport, and then took us to Hotel Turner. We had a room at the last floor, the 6th. It seemed new, completely renovated. The room was quite big, decorated in an antic mode, my wife loved it... she said that she fel very aristocratic. We met the owner of the hotel. Mr Longo, he said to call him Tony, planned a very rich itinerary for us: the bus and the guide was at our disposal from 08 to midnight. We saw at least 15 churches, the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps etc, but the most important thing was the Vatican City and a private visit with The Pope (they booked this visit 8 months before for us). It was incredible! As you know us Greeks, are orthodox, we are not subject to the Vatican, but meeting the Pope was a beautiful experience for all of us. The hotel has a Internet WiFI FREE connection in the lobby and the rooms. It was very fast, we stayed in touch with our friends back home with Skype, for free. One of our friends had a laptop problem, and the hotel computer guy they called fix his computer in less than 2 hours. I do not know how much it costed but my friend was very happy afterwards, so I don't think it was much. Breakfast was quite rich, it had everything... I recommend to try the italian breakfast way: cappuccino and corneto. I think the position of the hotel is central, but most of the time we used the bus they provided with the guide. The metro is near the hotel. We used it a couple of times to go to Piazza Barberini and Piazza di sPagna. It was one of the best trips our church ever organized, and lots of compliments go to Hotel Turner and their organization. Our group was very pleased with this hotel's services. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Deddilus
Reviews.Content: very very very beautiful!!! i feel good in this hotel. i like the stuff, the room, the place, the feeling with people. I say one word... WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE! Andrea now in London City

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure staying there”
Reviews.Author: littlesim
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome on a business trip and I checked in at Turner hotel.I can say it was a nice experience and I want to share this with everyone.This hotel is located in the center of The Eternal City and it is very easy to get to.There is a 24 hour reception open so you can check in or out whenever you choose. The room I stayed in had everything : a big king size bed , TV with lots of programs , air conditioning , minibar , telephone and free Hi-Fi internet access ;also bathroom with shower and bath tub. Everyone in the hotel was very helpful and friendly during my stay ;they gave me directions for my meetings throughout Rome and recommended nice restaurants. It really was a pleasure staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jacob_Martin_06-80
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel one week ago with my friends. We were very well received and I asked the room service which was very fast. This hotel is practically in the Old Town, and is near the bus stop and taxi station. The rooms are not "huge" but are well furnished with period furniture and marble bathrooms complete with Jacuzzi! The room cost is very reasonable for the service that was offered. Once we asked information at the reception desk and the staff was very friendly and advised us well. I think I'll back very soon at this hotel with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Classic old hotel in great offbeat neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: travelcritic22
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the price and pictures looked good. It had very italian interior which was great. But what we really loved was that it was right near a great farmer's market and loads of terrific restaurants, gellato and coffee bars.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: GoodwinsSuffolk
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to write lots as most people have it covered. But I did want to add that this hotel has a very good location. There are two bus routes which are helpful for tourists that stop right in front of hotel, 60 & 62. In general the hotel is clean, tidy and beautifully decorated, the bathrooms in particular are covered in marble, the hotel is very pretty and has a romatic vibe. The staff could be friendlier, but they are efficient and prompt when asked for help. Some of the rooms are a little on the small side and can feel a bit claustraphobic. The rooms also dont have air-con which in a 4 star hotel is disapointing. I have rated sleep quality as only 2 because pillows were hard and there was no air-con. In all the hotel is attractive, clean, reasonably priced and centrally loacted - cant say better!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mabo84
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in this hotel. Traditional building but very old! The rooms certainly need to be renovated. Our triple room was cozy but small, it was clean but didn't feel clean. The bathroom had a small shower. Helpful staff. Breakfast was in a nice room and offered a good variety. Bus stop right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed - wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: H1202
Reviews.Content: I had booked the hotel about 4 months before the trip - during this time, I emailed the hotel twice and not once did they ever reply. I thought this was rude and very unprofessional. When we arrived at the hotel, the man at reception was very rude and ignorant. there was no hello, welcome, how was your journey...nothing. The bell boy then came and took my boyfriends back - how gentlemanly, thankfully my boyfriend carried my bag. The room wasn't much, to be honest the bathroom was nicer than the bedroom. The tv had 1 english channel which had the same picture all the time, not that we were there to watch tv but its nice to have the option. Breakfast was a little disappointing, tea and bread and pastries and you were lucky if there was any orange juice left or glasses even. We did not stay in the hotel much, the other staff members were just as ignorant too. Definitely wouldnt stay there again. The location was fine, there was a stop outside for buses which were very frequent and only a ten min bus ride to major sights. Thankfully we went to rome for the sights and not for a nice hotel, because you wont get that with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money. ministeries and embassies around. nice restaurants near by. I reccomend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Seriana
Reviews.Content: We were at the room 222 - I reccomend it - gold, fancy, quite spacy and very cosy - big bathroom! - great for the money! Location ok- safe and prestige, though not in the center, it took a while to walk back to the hotel. stuff friendly and helpfull, breakfast - ok. Clean towers and bed [--] :) Beautifull enteriors. I you want to feel the real atmosphere of classic rome book here! So different from a tipical hotels. Very romantic! It is not a 4 star hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “For everyone! Try and try again!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaLondon_76
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends we were just at this hotel. We were really good and we felt at peace. The location is excellent! The staff is helpful and pulzia is good! The price is really low! The breakfast, included, is excellent and comfortable. Everything is decorated and beautiful marble. I recommend it to all types of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect , great value, lovely resaurants arround every street corner”
Reviews.Author: IrelandGoldengirls
Reviews.Content: could not find any fault with Hotel Turner great value , good location bus stop straight outside, lots of little markets arround, we founs Rome very reasonable to buy and eat out

Reviews.Title: “Good experience - excellent value”
Reviews.Author: BluePhantom
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through the 1800 Hotel website at a very good rate. My wife, adult daughter and I shared a triple room which was very adequate. We arrived on the morning of October 23rd around 9:30AM. Check in was smooth. Our room wasn't ready, so they stored our luggage and we set off walking and viewed the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and other area sights. We also picked up the Roma pass which we planned to validate the next day. Upon returning to the hotel we unpacked and then proceeded to the "gem" of the place - the roof terrace. We had purchased some wine from a grocery in the neighborhood. We did this ritual at the end of each day of sightseeing and it really added a lot to the trip. We totally utilized the Roma pass and spent the next three days sightseeing. The Metro stop was about a 5 - 7 minute walk. The 90 express bus went right to the Termini and the 60 express bus went right into the downtown area. Both stops were right outside the hotel. The breakfasts were excellent with plenty of fruit, rolls, eggs and bacon. The folks at the front desk were very nice. There were plenty of shops ind eating places in the neighborhood. We checked out the morning of the 27th, took the express bus to the Termini and caught the train to Florence. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Book HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Victora_1987
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the center, beautiful area with pizza and Italian ice cream. The breakfast. Beautiful lounge and common areas, the rooms stylish and comfortable. I felt very comfortable. Excellent value between quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel 4 Stars in an Excellent Area”
Reviews.Author: NikeBoston
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and professional. Our room was very comfortable and quiet despite had view road. Very good and varied breakfast served in a luxurious environment. Excellent value for money. Is certainly to be recommended!

Reviews.Title: “dont book it”
Reviews.Author: BelfastJane
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and allocated room 408 once we left the lobby it all went down hill. Had to take a very dodgy lift to 4th floor the walls are covered in padded wallpaper that is absolutely filthy and dates back to 1960s the room was tiny and the decor just got worse. The furniture was old and shabby and nothing like that shown on the website. The bathroom was disgusting broken toilet seat, pipes the dated back to the 50's and a hairdryer that you were frightened to turn on in case it exploded! This hotel is not good value for money we were only staying for 3 nights so put up with it but in hindsight would have paid that little bit more for a good 3 star the Turner hotel is NOT a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “simply don´t go there”
Reviews.Author: ChrizzyB
Reviews.Content: fungus on the walls, bathrooms are disgusting, service is a word Turner staff has not heard about, don´t even go for money...

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: jdumbreck
Reviews.Content: This was a great find, wish we could have stayed longer. The rooms were really lovely, clean and the staff very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was plentiful with a large choice to suit all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: eaglebayCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of a 3 nights package including breakfast in may 09. The hotel wasnt more than 1 km from the central station and only 300 meters from the subway! The hotelroom was about 6 meters to the ceiling and allthough it is next to a very busy road there was no problem in sleeping. The hotel i like a 1900 century hotel (marble and mirrors everywhere) but in mint condition. The service was very accurate and polite. The breakfast buffet was to die for - everything was well prepared and fresh! Hotel Turner comes highly recommended - but do take the sub to old city center!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but too far from the main sights”
Reviews.Author: FionaColleen
Reviews.Content: Hotel turner was nice, but we found it to be too far from the main sights/restaurants etc. The rooms were clean, but also a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Good for low price”
Reviews.Author: sksinghal
Reviews.Content: Good low budget hotel. ...Most of the time Air conditioner was not working..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: babyruth1620
Reviews.Content: Turner hotel is perfect for a nice holiday in Rome as well for a business trip. Located in the heart of Rome near Porta Pia , one of the most important places in Rome the hotel gives a 19th century taste of the area. Getting there is not very hard , the Termini station ( the biggest in Rome) is not too far about 10 minutes by foot. The room in which we checked-in was a lovely one , with all conforts included such as air conditioning , tv , phone and a full mini-bar. Also the bathroom always clean and shiny with a nice tub and shower.Wireless internet also works. The staff of the hotel well trained , helpful and can provide useful informations during your stay so don' t hesitate to ask. You find someone there 24 hours per day at the front desk. The hotel's restaurant is one of the best in the area with great food and wine. We highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: jmvoyagerNewYork
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for the price. Close to a subway station, one stop from the central station. If you don`t mind walking like us, you won`t have any trouble getting everywhere. Because we weren`t sure at first, we took a cab from the station and it cost 30 euros. The room was small but normal for europe. It wasn`t the cleanest but not enough to be bad. The bathroom was big and we had presure in the shower. We don`t know about the ac because in April we didn`t need it. We had a fridge and a safe in the room which was convenient for us. We went to the grocery store by the hotel to buy water bottles and put them in the fridge. The neigborhood is nice and not too expensive with two cafés next door. If you expect a 4 stars will be desapointed but if you think of a 2 1/2 hotel, you will be happy. The staff is friendly but they don`t know much about the tourist attractions, you are better off going to the tourist office.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a very personal atmosphere, almost like staying with friends”
Reviews.Author: blauemadeleine
Reviews.Content: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D_ECgrBQTJU The rooms were spacious, the furnishing tasteful but most important of all, the friendly and courteous manner of the people working there. Ms Laura who would enquirer about the well being of every guest and who would go out of her way to make one feel welcome. I visited Rome a lot of times, but never was I so happy with the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “We didnt walk, WE RAN!!!”
Reviews.Author: whitebird443
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor is the smartest way to look up hotels. They do give wonderful opinions all around. I should have used this when booking a two week trip with my better half. Walk into the room and realize that it stops at the entrance. This wasnt roman style, it was a disaster of Traditional French and Im an immigrated italian in a new country so lets keep plastic on the furniture 90 year old grand mother style. Fridge inside of the cabinet that was worth more than fridge "baller" for those who know what that means. No Ac, shower was 2' by 2', with plastic sliding doors. Water Damage. I checked out the next morning. I booked with expedia and lost the funds for the week's stay. However i did suggest to the staff that perhaps they have the room rented out, so they could hire a contractor and remodel the room. Then again italian worker? perhaps not the best idea. - FYI I AM ITALIAN. Upon leaving the cab driver looked at me and said "oh you decided to change hotel? Good Choice."

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some problems with the rooms”
Reviews.Author: raindropsonroses
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights and had to change rooms twice as we had problems with the tv reception, bathroom and air conditioning. Not a great start to our European holiday. The three rooms we stayed in during our stay were all quite different in size and layout. Our first room was small and the bathroom layout was strange - the bidet was right in front of the shower, making it very hard to get into the shower. Our third and final room was a lot more spacious and the bathroom was much better. When we finally got a good room on the third night, we started to enjoy our stay more. The hotel's decor is quite lovely and unique. There was free wi-fi in the lobby, and also one computer available for guests to use. There is a metro station about 10 minutes away, but we found that the buses were more convenient. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel with buses that go to Termini, the Colosseum, and St Peter's Square. The concierge even drew the bus routes on our map, which was very helpful. The breakfast was quite good even though the selection was limited. Their cappuccino was very good.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK...”
Reviews.Author: NormaNorma
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Turner Hotel. Overall, it was quite pleasant, and the staff were friendly and helpful. While the hotel was what you'd expect for a city hotel (quite basic, but clean and comfortable), it was quite a walking distance from the main sites (about a good 15 minute walk), which, as we were doing a lot of walking during the day anyway, the extra walk was quite tiresome to our already aching feet.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: samartin26
Reviews.Content: Our Roman adventure started with an over-priced cab journey to the hotel, so it was a welcome relief to step inside the Turner to find a friendly face and rather grand surroundings! Our room had marble flooring, fabric covered walls, elegant cornicing and ceiling. The bed was in a rococo style. So far so stylish and so Italian. Very nice... Breakfast was tasty and plentiful and fuelled us up for tours of the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the area”
Reviews.Author: Cedonia44
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best choice i could have made while staying in Rome. I had transfer from the airport to the hotel and back included in the price for the room and didn't have to pay anything extra which was great cause i don't know Rome that well. The room i had ordered was exactly as they showed it on the website , with a big confortable bed, large tv with cable, minibar, phone, free internet connection and non-stop room-service.The bathroom with tub and shower. The breakfast is also included in the price and it is served in the lovely restaurant downstairs; the waiters very kind by the way, and i can say that about all the hotel's staff. I really felt like home in this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mel51
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a few days at the Turner and enjoyed every minute. The staff are great and Laura in the dining room is welcoming and knowlegeable. The corridor areas of the hotel are looking a bit 'tired' but the rooms are clean, fresh and a good size. The scaffolding mentioned by a previous reviewer was being removed as we left and will be totally down in the next few days. The hotel looks great behind the scaffolding, a lot of new marble and a freshly painted facade.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: onemachado
Reviews.Content: We traveled through Europe for about a month and stayed in a variety of different hotels throughout our visit. This hotel was very nice (a supposed 4 star hotel!) but the customer service was lacking. When we checked in the concierge told us that breakfast was included in our price, and we didnt think it was so we asked him again if he was sure and he said, "In your case it is included". Then after the second morning of eating there we we told by a very nice waitress in the breakfast area that breakfast was not included! We assumed she had made a mistake and went to talk to the people at the front desk and found out indeed that it was not include! We had to talk to multiple different people over 2 days trying to sort this out and everyone was saying the we were probably out of luck. We finally talk to the same guy who checked us and and he basically made us out to be liars about the whole thing and was adamant that he never said that. After a good argument they reluctantly allowed us those mornings to be included. As I said...it is a really nice hotel, but the location is a far walk to stuff really worth seeing (not the biggest deal as a bus stop is close), but the concierge really made it a bad experience. Your choice, chance getting bad customer service and spend a lot of time fighting for what you had be promised or try somewhere else. If you do go, make sure make sure make sure (and get it in writing) that what they tell you when you check in is what they are actually going to give you.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: bvlenci
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just outside the Porta Pia gate, in a mixed residential/commercial neighborhood. There is a bus stop just a few steps from the door, and a bus (number 90) that gets you to Termini station in just a few minutes. It took us a total of 15 minutes from checking out to arriving at Termini early on a Sunday morning. On the downside, there isn't much to see within easy walking distance. However, the catacomb of Priscilla, the early Christian basilica of Sant'Agnese fuori le Mura are all within an easy bus ride.The Villa Borghese is also pretty near by. We got a great bargain on the hotel, which is supposedly a 4 star, but in my opinion would be more accurately considered a 3 star. If we had paid full price, I might have felt that it wasn't worth it. The hotel is decorated in a rather flamboyant style: red flocked wallpaper, gold leaf everywhere, marble floors and bath fixtures. I had read that the hotel was not very clean, but we found everything spotless. The bathroom was rather small and didn't have a tub. The shower stall had some sort of hydro massage which was not great, but for a normal shower there was plenty of hot water and good pressure. There was a safe and minibar. The hotel offers free wifi and has an internet point for the use of guests. The staff were all helpful and friendly and all spoke at least some English. The breakfast was pretty good: more than a continental breakfast but less than an English breakfast. There were boiled eggs, salami, cheese, cereal, pastries and juices. Cappuccino was offered, along with other kinds of coffee and tea. Some renovations were going on at the time, so we occasionally had to walk around ladders. Maybe this is why the price was so heavily discounted. All in all, I was quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel Turner”
Reviews.Author: LondonLittleMiss
Reviews.Content: When we stayed at the Hotel Turner I could not fault it one little bit. I imagine that there are some rooms that need a bit of tarting up, but the room I stayed in was lovely. The bathroom was great, lots of marble and gold!! The hotel staff are friendly and helpful, when we arrived they took a photocopy of our passorts and gave them right back., they did not ask to keep hold of them. The breakfast was very good, it usual consisted of criossants, jams, honeys, hard boild eggs, processed cheese, cereals, rolls, and all the usual breakfast beverages. No complaints about the breakfast at all, the waitress that worked there every morning was friendly and exceptionally helpful. The area itself is not at all rough, but it is a little bit out of the city centre. However we were able to walk into the city in about 15 mins or ask the staff fro the best bus to get from outside the hotel. The hotel is also about 15 mins away from the Termini Sation (which is very unpleasant) so you do not have to worry about that as it is no where near the station. I loved Rome and I loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely holiday in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Lulabelle200
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for sightseeing in Rome; just a short bus ride to most attractions/areas! The bus stop was right outside our Hotel...number 62! The hotel was clean and tidy, friendly staff (especially our 'breakfast lady')! The decor is classically italian baroque with grand marble interior. The only downside, was the tiny shower!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great city”
Reviews.Author: Mario8420
Reviews.Content: On my business trip to Rome my wife booked my stay there to this wonderful hotel situated in the heart of the city.I arrived there in the evening and my room was ready.The receptionist was very kind and helpful 24 hours a day. The room i had booked was very large with a fully equiped minibar , telephone, a big tv with cable and a very good internet connection.Had also a nice balcony with a great view of the city. Everyday the breakfast was perfect. The staff was outstanding with an impecable outfit provided by tha hotel.Every time I returned from the city my room was very clean and very welcoming. For those who dont have a car the metro is 2 minutes away. I will definitely be staying there next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Book This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vacationqueen1980
Reviews.Content: In my opinion after staying here with my boyfriend in March 2008, this hotel does not deserve 4 star status at all. The building is undeniably beautiful on the inside. The outside is covered in scaffolding however which we were not made aware of when we booked. The first room we were given was furnished beautifully and on the surface looked fine however when we went to put our belongings in the wardrobe it reeked of sick. The bathroom was peach and brown and very dated and a huge black mould patch was on one walls. On closer inspection of the room, the wallpaper was beginning to peel off with damp. We asked to move rooms to a less damp one and got a free upgrade. This was less worse but it still had a bad mould problem. The room had beautiful high ceilings, impressive wall coverings and furniture and the bathroom was spacious. However it was very, very dirty and the bedding rather disgusting as it was stained and smelled of sweat and perfume. It was also freezing cold and the ‘heater’ control in the room was hanging off. Our windows didn’t close properly so it was very noisy from the busy main road outside the hotel. It was even more noisy on the weekdays because the builders on the aforementioned scaffolding begin work at 8am and make a huge racket. They worked literally outside of our window too so there was little privacy. The most hideous thing about this room however was the bathroom – we were upgraded to the room with the Jacuzzi. Be warned before you book that this is a shower cubicle which looks like it was created in 1990 (the once white colour is now beige and brown, control buttons worn and black mould on much of the plastic which spouts water). The steam system inside of this disgusting cubicle did not work and the ‘jacuzzi’ part is merely the name of the brand. Do not pay for the upgrade for this. Also the hairdryer is a bizarre contraption which works as effectively as having your partner blow on your hair so I would advise you to take your own ladies. However the sockets in this place were horrendous and despite being on a holiday where we stayed in four different EU cities and so had used my plugs and electronic equipment in other hotels on my trip, I couldn’t get anything to work in the room as all the sockets were loose. The wardrobe in this room also stunk so we couldn’t actually unpack anything. The location of this hotel was OK with about a 7 minute walk to the metro station – but we are young fit and healthy so if you have any type of disability, are elderly or have a pushchair you may wish to rethink booking at this location. To get to the station you have to cross over many very busy roads, up and down curbs and down lots of steps. We didn’t eat at the hotel (the hygiene of the rooms was enough to put us off) so we can’t comment on the food. I’m afraid to say I would stay in this hotel again if I was paid to. We got it for an absolute bargain price of £58 per night – as it should have been in the hundreds. I felt robbed of that tiny amount so I definitely would not pay vast amounts to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueeny
Reviews.Content: After looking at the photos on the website and taking into account Hotel Turner was supposed to be a 4 star hotel, I was shocked at what I ended up with. First impressions were not good. I dont know who is to blame, laterooms.com or the hotel staff but I was not made aware that refurbishment works were taking place during my stay. In fact the whole of the front of the hotel was covered in scaffolding to the point that you could only just make out whether it was night of day through the think green net which covered each of the windows. Upon arrival in Reception I was greeted by a sour faced man who to my surprise did at least let us check in earlier than normal but that was short lived. After taking a trip in the Tower of terror lift and making in to the 4th floor we walked straight into our room which was still being cleaned, and were forced to walk back along the dirty, shabby corridor and take the dreaded lift back down again. Is there somewhere we can get a coffee? Or a bar we can wait in until the room is ready? NO was my answer 'walk to the top of the road'. Later that day when we returned to the room and were able to properly take in our surroundings it took all my energy not to turn around and walk straight out again. I enjoy camping, I am not a princess but I honestly couldn't bring myself to put my feet on the carpet for fear of what lived in it. The bathroom was so small there was barely room to shut the door once in, and the shower was so dirty, dark and dingy I preferred to stay dirty for one more day. A positive is that the bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. Breakfast was minimal but our waitress was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “About average”
Reviews.Author: Pastylover
Reviews.Content: The hotel room we booked was a superior double and was spacious with high ceilings. The decor was interesting but exactly as we expected (we are not fans of boring modern hotels!) However, the rooms could have done with being a little cleaner. The beds were clean but the rug on the floor looked very old and the bathroom needed a good lick of paint and new fittings all round. It had a jacuzzi bath, which we did use but only after giving it a clean ourselves as it didnt look "spotless" which is what I would have liked. The location was OK, with convenient buses passing into the historical centre every 5-15 minutes but we are young and dont mind cramming onto the public transport, whereas I would imagine for a family with young children or older guests it may not be as suitable. Breakfast was OK, nothing special but no complaints and the restaurant and reception staff were on the whole helpful and pleasant. I probably wouldnt return to this hotel again because for the amount paid for the room I would expect a bit more for the money. However, I wouldnt put people off going either as it certainly wasnt all dissapointing and if you are like me and like a hotel with a bit of character then you may well find you have a great experience. Rome itself was excellent and we actually spent so little time in our hotel room as there is so much to see and do, the hotel standard certainly didnt have any negative effect on our short time in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “No problem”
Reviews.Author: weblist
Reviews.Content: I experienced none of the negative aspects posted by other reviewers The Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The room was good and we loved the decoration The breakfast was good. We had two chlidren with us who enjoyed the whole experience. The Hotel is 10 mins from the centre and we used buses or taxis which stopped outside the hotel. The waitress in the morning was a star and couldnt do enough to help

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: GrahamNI
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Turner was interesting to say the least. Our party of 5 had 3 rooms and we stayed for 3 nights. On arrival we were hardly greeted, more frowned at! Very little eye contact and none from the more mature man on reception. To be fair they did make one room available to us as we had arrived early. (We dumped bags and got busy with lunch). In Room 104 the bidet is IN the shower, yes IN the shower. While this may be used a single room there is NO excuse to have a bidet IN a shower! The other rooms, 202 and 220 were ok, but only ok. Two safes in 202, one of which worked, the safe in 220 didnt work at all. Tiny showers, although we felt that it was a bonus for the water to be hot! The furniture just looks old, worn and tacky, not in any way glam. like the marbled reception area. The v. small lounge looks, and feels like a funeral directors waiting area. The place just didnt feel cosy or welcoming. The breakfast room was fine and the choice was simply excellent. The service there was good too, though you have to speak up or you may miss out on your coffee. The smell of burning was strong as we exited the v. small lift on our first day. I reported this to reception and was met with ..... a shrug of the shoulders from the mature male on duty. (NO eye contact from him). I insisted that the problem be solved as it was a fire risk, (a faulty light tube), and only when I insisted was the job attended to. Check out was a total drama with a computer crash and the phone lines being down! One female staff on duty at 7.30 am! Very stressed and very unprofessional. When I asked her to order a taxi she said NO! So, I reached her MY mobile phone...... the look on her face was priceless..... then she indicated that she didnt know how to dial the taxi company number! Three beautiful young Russian ladies were also guests, apparently staying for the weekend and demanded the best room for them to share! Other guests included a delightful Finnish couple, we were in fact handed their passports in error! We checked out, with some relief........ and paid €139 per room per night, incl breakfast......... we dont plan to return. Rome is a big city, there must be better hotels in this price range, especially as this one didnt have a restaurant or a bar. Btw, the night porter was charming and a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel So-So”
Reviews.Author: lizhunt03
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in Rome in late September 2007. The outside of the hotel was being renovated, so it wasn't much to look at when we were arriving. Our room was slightly above average--the wood floor was nice, it was fairly roomy (I think we may have had a small suite, as other guests we spoke to didn't have some of the same amenties as we did--namely the jacuzzi tub). Speaking of the Jacuzzi, it was pretty nice to soak sore feet and legs after a day of walking around. I am not sure the tub was the cleanest when I got in though, as there was a strange ring of scum when it drained (I don't think I was THAT dirty!!!). Our room did face the street so it was not the quietest of rooms, but earplugs came in handy. The decor was kind of cheesy and seemed outdated, not elegant/antique. Our major issue with this hotel is that my husband called for a wakeup call so that we could catch our train to Venice the next morning and THEY DID NOT CALL US, causing us to wake up late and miss our train (we simply went to the train station and caught the next train but it was a pain as we did not have assigned seats and had to keep getting up when people came on board whose seats we were sitting in). The hotel did not seem to think it was any big deal that they had caused us to miss our train and did not offer to do anything about it (we also woke up so late we missed breakfast, which was included for us).

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: smileman
Reviews.Content: I dont understand why everyone is so passionate about this hotel in one way or another. It's fine for the price. Staff are friendly. Its not the cleanest place nor the dirtiest. Rooms are y room a small, ypical for older Eurpean hotels. Breakfast was nothing special. Free WiFi in lobby and 1 free internet computer. Very quiet area close to bus routes and some reasonable restaurants for pizza and pasta. Would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “You will find better”
Reviews.Author: jkmolloy
Reviews.Content: Just back from a ten day holiday to Italy four of which where spent in Rome staying in the Hotel Turner. Professionally I have many years experience in the hotel business so believe me when I say this is not a 4* hotel far from it. The hotel needs up grading, it boosts Jacuzzi shower it didn't work, the breakfast was very poor, there are no other facilities, no bar, no restaurant, no room service if you are looking for just a bed for the night and i must stay the bed was quite comfortable well the Turner is ok but I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jellyfish1967
Reviews.Content: Myself and my best friend stayed at this hotel for three nights on August 6th 2007. Plus points was that the hotel was in an excellent position for reaching the sights of Rome. The Breakfast room was stunning and very opulent. The staff were exceptionally kind and courteous. The only negative point was the size of the bedroom...a little pokey with very ittle hanging space. All in all a fantastic holiday though!

Reviews.Title: “Opulence!!”
Reviews.Author: celine41
Reviews.Content: Very lush hotel!! In a very nice waelthy bit of town. Next to loads of secret gems. Easy bus trip to town or 15-20min walk. Probably better than staying right in the centre as its a quiter, better kept area. The hotel had beautiful decoration and furniture. Lots of marble, gold guilting and silk damask. Very luxurious. Feel like a princess for a day!! Staff on the front desk weren't that friendly though. Apart from that it definitely feels like a 4*!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decorations”
Reviews.Author: newlywed2306
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Turner, Porta Pia during my second honeymoon in Rome with my husband. This hotel is excellent as a 3.5 stars hotel but there are many things in this hotel that has to be improved in order to achieve 4 stars quality. The hotel is located at Porta Pia, about 800metres from Termini Central Station and 50 metres from the British Embassy in Italy. One can get to this hotel by taking bus number 90 from Termini (get off at second stop) or bus number 56 also from Termini (get off at fifth stop). The view of the hotel entrance from outside was very nice. We arrived at the hotel at about 7 pm and the check-in process took about 5 minutes and we were given the key to our room straight away. The porter had helped us carrying our bag to our room. Our room was in second floor and it was a superior room with jacuzzi bath inside and also a small balcony that facing the main street of via Nomentana. Although I was very impressed with the interior design of the hotel (very Italian style) and also the room, I must say that the size of the room was smaller than the standard hotel room in my country. But since I've had similar experience with hotels in London, I reckoned that with the price I've paid, I could only get the room about this size. By the way, the room costs me about EUR 225 which is equivalent to £154 for 3 nights stayed in superior room type. However, since this hotel didn't have any coffee/tea facilities in the room, me and my husband have to go out to have a cup of coffee at one of the cafe around this hotel area. (A small cup of cappuccino served in restaurant/cafe can cost you about EUR 3, very very expensive indeed. Try to have a mug of cappuccino at normal price at the self service cafe in Termini station.) Back to the hotel review, as other reviewers have said before, the lady at the reception of the hotel wasn't so friendly but she wasn't bad either. She gave us a handy city map that we found useful. The breakfast room was not so small, enough to accommodate people staying at this hotel at one time since the breakfast time was from 7 to 10 am. The room was beautifully decorated with chandeliers and lots of mirror everywhere made this room looked even bigger. Nevertheless, the breakfast was not the best I've ever had. Since I am a Muslim, I just can ate breads and cereals because the other foods served were not 'halal'. But from what I can see, the choice of foods was very limited. I didn't like the croissant since it has jam in it and not the normal butter croissant I've had in UK. The Americano coffee served by this hotel tasted awful for me. However, my husband loves the breads that this hotel served so much. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to my friends if they can get the room at the same, cheap price like we had.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alibel
Reviews.Content: Overall a good hotel which was value for money. We booked a superior double which was worth the extra 10 euros a night. Room was a decent size as was the bathroom and we had a balcony over looking Porta Oia. Good area for transport and getting round the city. Area quiet in the evenings with some lovely resturants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with my experience”
Reviews.Author: frantastic18
Reviews.Content: Firstly, thanks to the other reviews on Tripadvisor. I read them before I went and they were really helpful. There are mixed reviews about this hotel and it made me a little anxious. However my experience was lovely. They tried to give us room 122 first and after reading a review on here I already had alarm bells about this room. We looked in it and it was dark and small and the baroque decoration is too much for the room and makes it feel very claustrophobic. There is no window either so its very dark. We didn't even unpack and asked to move. The guy at the desk was very accomadating and we were moved immediately to room 532. This was more like the superior room I booked, and we were very happy with it. Other than initially being given a small room, everything else about the hotel was perfect. The rooms are very clean,the bed was very comfortable and huge, the cleaners even put my flowers in water for me. Some of the other complaints on here are true; the lift is very small, the breakfast simple but acceptable, and you do have to walk up a flight of stairs to reach the fifth floor. If I was expecting to stay in a four star hotel I would be disappointed but then I didn't pay a four star hotel price for it. It is a very central location and easy to find. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “above average”
Reviews.Author: se_traveler79
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in early january. It was above my expectations, considering the very low price we paid. The location was nice; just a 15 minute walk to the center and 5 min walk to the nearest metro station. The room was small, but the bathroom was very clean. The breakfast was above average when compared to most of the Italian hotels in this class. Overall, I think its a nice, small and clean hotel to stay in Rome, if you are concerned about your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Hated hotel Turner”
Reviews.Author: Travelsavvy81
Reviews.Content: I can't think of a good comment for Hotel Turner in Rome: it is neither central or in a pretty area, staff were unhelpful and rude, our standard room overlooked a very dark staircase or something like it. Basically our room was in darkness 24 hours a day. It was really depressing, considering I went there in spring, I would have at least liked to see the morning sunshine through my window! At breakfast time, there was a queue to sit down as all the tables were taken at 8.30/9.00 am. The waitress was stressed out and would rather you didn't show up at all which would have been a better choice than to eat reconstituted croissants that need to be heated up to be edible! All this came at a very high price so beware of the Turner Hotel! Ah, one good comment: at least the rooms were clean for the price me and my friend were paying!

Reviews.Title: “I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Winkle1981
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, rooms are alittle small, this is an old hotel and some cracks etc should be tolerated......do not go there if your extra fussy! pay more money if you like to complain! The hotel is clean, very pretty, nice decor-bit over the top but gives a nice character to the hotel! good transport links to the centre of Rome. No english TV channels.....doesnt really matter, you are in Rome go have fun/ have sex/ talk to your loved one!!! Breakfast alittle bland, staff alittle rude but doesnt take away from the hotel. I recommened this hotel as it something a bit different, i went with my girlfriend of 2weeks and had a fantastic time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “quite nice”
Reviews.Author: alfiereading
Reviews.Content: well me and my partner stayed at the turner for 3 nites on a whole are stay there was brill except the breakfast dont even bother its terrible afew cerial and cakes not my cuppa tea i would of been happier with a milky coffee and a slice of toast so we didnt bother going down for breakfast for the rest of our stay. Our Room was Fantastic such a lovely room we had paid for one the best so we had a jacuzzi bath and shower and it was fantastic we couldnt believe our eyes when we opened our bedroom door we had to kingssize beds our room was massive we had a seperate walk in dressing room the decor was just what i expected of rome marble floors and marble bathroom so romantic. The reception staff were not that friendly and did not understand alot of english but hey we are in intaly not england. And rome is so lovely what a beautiful city would defently go back

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: quilthappy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not maintained well, room was borderline dirty. We were told we were not allowed coffee in our room. The bed was very uncomfortable two twin beds put together. Would not recommend this hotel or ever stay again. Spend a few extra dollars and be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I was Turned off by Hotel Turner”
Reviews.Author: BrokenSuitcase
Reviews.Content: Hi Everyone! My wife and I recently returned from our honeymoon through Italy. We had many nice memories unfortunately our stay at Hotel Turner was not one of them. * Reviews based on 5-star maximum Booking (4.5 stars) We booked our 5 night stay through their hotel website which was very easy. Hotel Staff - Waiters/Bell Hops (4 stars) For the most part they were very friendly and helpful. Hotel Staff - Hotel Concierges (2.5 stars) Besides the older gentleman that worked in the late nights we found the two men and woman to be a little impatient . They seemed to just want to get conversations over with and get back to sitting quietly behind the check in counter. Please keep this in mind if you decide to stay here and judge for yourself. I hate to see what they would be like if Italy had not won the World Cup. Hotel Decor - (3 stars) This is based purely on my opinion so this should not make much of a difference in your decision to stay. The pictures available through this site of the hotel is a pretty accurrate representation of the decor, the only difference is that in person the hotel appears darker than the pictures portray. Other than that, pretty much the same. Hotel Rooms - (2 stars / 3 stars) We booked a 5 night stay in a superior room. Upon checking in (by impatient lady) we were issued a key for room 120. When we got up to the room I thought we were mistakenly issued a standard room. The room was so small that we could barely find a place for our suit cases. Please keep in mind that we traveled pretty light (2 roller bags and a back pack). The window for the room faces a dark enclosure and the walls are covered in a gold colored fabric cloth and a gold bed takes up the rest of the space in the room. It was a strange feeling being in a room that small with that kind of decor, I almost felt like a pimp checking on his establishment. Which was kind of cool in a way at first. We stayed in the room that evening and then asked to be moved to a larger room the next morning. If we were paying 260 dollars a night, we wanted a room where we could at least open up our bags to get our clothes. So the next day we were issued the key for room 122. Ah yes, finally some room to store our bags and still be able to walk around the room without stepping all over the bed. This room was much better than room 120, but still it wasn't that large. The last issue that I should make known is that the AC system in the hotel is not very good. We couldn't open our window because we were facing a busy street so we had to deal with the hotel AC system that seemed to be barely pushing any air into the room. One minor thing to note, since we did have an opportunity to stay in two different rooms in the hotel I noticed that some TV channels available in one room wasn't available in the next and vice-versa, not a big deal but just something I noticed. Bathroom - (4 stars) They were pretty nice, not very big but big enough to do what you need to do. Room 120 didn't have a bath tub, only shower but room 122 had both tub and shower. Complimentary Breakfast - (2 stars) I usually don't eat much for breakfast so it was not a big deal for me. However I feel I must give it only 2 stars from all the complaints I heard from the other guests. First off there is not much to eat. If you get there late usually most of the items are gone and you'll have to choose from whatever is left on display. Your choices are bread rolls, some type of cake, salami and cheese and a very limited supply of fresh fruit. Not that bad but many guests were asking aloud "Is that it?" Again not a big deal for me since I'm fine eating a few bites for breakfast (plus I started enjoying my 10:00AM slice of pizza). One day while we were eating a man spoke loudy in the dining area about the breakfast being unacceptable and then all the other guests began agreeing with him. Next he starting saying the rooms were too small and again everyone started agreeing with him. Soon after that I grabbed my wife and left the dinning room, as entertaining as it was I knew we were in Rome and had many things to see, we would probably have other opportunites to join in a hotel mutiny in our local town of Los Angeles. Location (3 stars) It was fine for me. Porta Pia is a quieter area that is quite close to the central bus/train station. There is a bus stop almost right in front of the hotel which is quite convenient. During the day there are some street vendors and a few stores that can offer some shopping opportunities. There is also a local market around the corner where you can buy some groceries if you don't feel like eating out or just some water and drinks for the room. The prices of the grocery store is really good. Make a right when you exit to hotel, right again at the first street, walk down many 200 feet and on your right hand side you will find the door to the market. Local Area Eats (4 stars) There is actually a very good place if you make a left upon exiting the hotel. Walk to the first street and make a left again. On the right hand side of the street there is a restaurant with some reviews posted on the front door. The pasta there is great. Pretty good prices too compared to the other touristy places you will find in Rome with mediocre food.

Reviews.Title: “I recomment it to everyone”
Reviews.Author: mry76
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent our honeymoon at Turner Hotel and i would like to recommend to all the others couples do to the same. It was perfect in every way:the food just great, the room very bright and with a lovely view, the staff very helpful and kind so I can only say it was a pleasure to be there. I would like so say thank you to everyone there for making our stay as they did.

Reviews.Title: “just great,”
Reviews.Author: hussam_ahmed71
Reviews.Content: Ok,where do i begin. I am a bussiness man and i travel all around the world. What can i say about Turner hotel? At my stay there everything was perfect: the food menu was rich, the staff was very helpful and kind, the room was spacious and bright with big windows. The staff organised private transportation for all my six meetings in Rome and from and to the airport. The hotel has a free wireless internet connection. I will always consider hotel Turner for my next visits to Rome.One word to describe hotel Turner: excellent.

Reviews.Title: “My opinion of the Turner Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ROBBER103
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Turner hotel with my bride on honeymoon. Like others we did let them know it was our honeymoon. Needless to say, don't bother. We were given a beautiful room, decor was definitely Italian and have no complaints of the room. The bathroom was Italian Marble like shown in several pictures and gorgeous. I was rather hoping for a room with the jaccuzzi tub but was given on with the jaccuzzi shower instead, honestly not a big deal. We stayed on the 5th floor which the lift did not go to and had to walk a flight up from the fourth floor. Honestly wasn't a big deal to us either. The continental breakfast was very adequate and in two very nice Italian marlbed decorated rooms, very pleasant area to eat in. The hotel is about a 25 minute walk to the colliseum and other historical sights vas well as the termini. Bus route very easy to use as well. The down fall of the hotel to me was there wereno English speaking tv channels at all. we could not get pay tv as they said the computer was down. I kind of felt this was a standard excuse from the front desk(reception desk). This was rather disappointing as there really isn't much to do at night if you're not a person who likes doing night clubs. My real problem was with the reception desk. The lady on the day shift and the fellow on the afternoon shift had absolutely no personality at all and in my opinion should not be doing this type of work. Very unfriendly indeed. The gentleman on the late shift nicest guy one can meet, and very helpful with an attitude one would expect from a hotel reception desk. I'd say if Turner hotel would like to make their place better they need to address these problems and then they'd be an awesome place in which I'd love to revisit. I must say I will return to Rome but will not stay at the Turner Hotel again only due to those issues. Hope others find this review helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: kml76
Reviews.Content: Hello. I planned this trip for years and Hotel Turner was a perfect choice for our vacation! We were greeted at the airport and transported into the city by the most gentle limousine driver. Our room was lovely, spacious, and the bathroom just incredible. Great staff, useful hints for marvelous restaurants, they organized an excellent personal guide for us, and in general helped us in every way they possibly could. The hotel has great public spaces decorated with very fine marble. The 2 vey big breakfast room are spectacular. As you can see from the photos the hotel really worked in order to create an aristocratic place. The chandeliers are magnificent! I cannot wait to return to Italy, I absolutely love the country, the people, the generosity, and I will stay at Hotel Turner any time.

Reviews.Title: “OK except for the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: David_HK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, old, dimly lit, and hovers between two- and three-stars. Perhaps we were given an old room because it was under-maintained, especially the bathroom. The showerhead attachment was broken, so the only way to have a shower was to hold the showerhead in one hand. The regulator was also faulty, resulting in water that varied between ice-cold and scalding from one minute to the next. The hotel seems to be preparing for some renovation work though, so perhaps all the older rooms will be gone soon. The continental breakfast was adequate, with sweet pastries, ham, cheese, bread rolls, juice, and coffee. No bacon and eggs or hot food. Location of the hotel is convenient, near Porta Pia which is roughly 20 minutes' walk from the Tritone fountain on Via Veneto. There is a bus station right outside the front door and the travel times to most of Rome's attractions are very short. We booked this hotel room on the Internet, but noticed online that the room rate dropped from €170 to €97 over the course of two weeks. We cancelled and re-booked three times and ended up paying the cheaper rate.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home...had a lot of fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are 8 teenagers staying at hotel Turner. The place is great! Very nice rooms, excellent service, incredible beautiful classic bathrooms (i have never seen bathrooms so big and beautiful) . Breakfast is very rich of all kinds of food. All the information you need Stefano or Mirella from the reception will provide for you. The buses are practically in front of the hotel and from there in a few minutes you can be to any historical place you want to go. The rooms are very big and a quad is truly a quad not a double with 2 extra beds. Rome is very hot these days so the air conditioning is a must, thank God in our rooms it works perfectly! Do not go to hotels without AC! It's really hot. Another piece of advice: before going sight seeing buy some drinks from the stores around, because around the monuments they can make you pay 5 euros for a bottle of 1\2 liter of water! That's all folks! Enjoy your holidays Melanie K

Reviews.Title: “Only stay there if you are desperate!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about my 4 night stay in the hotel turner having read reviews on here! I had booked a junior suite with jacuzzi but when I got there I was given a normal double room. I went back downstairs to be told that my original room was being refurbished. No one had warned me about this prior to my arrival and when I complained the receptionist didnt care. I had to point out I was paying for a junior suite but only getting a double room... only then did they reduce the price. So, having been trammed round three different rooms only to realise that the best I was going to get was a double room, we settled. Our room was a 'superior room'. However the shower bracket was not securely fitted to the wall and hit me on the back of the head. Very superior! We had a balcony but it was small and dirty with no chairs. However on a more positive note the room decor was pretty, but a cigarette burn in the bed spread made me uneasy from the offset. The room had a safe which we found useful. We found the reception staff very unhelpful. My boyfriend put a 20 euro note in a ticket machine and got no ticket - we asked the guy on reception to ring the helpline. He did ring but waited on hold for 60seconds before telling us he was too busy. He promised to try again later in the day - we enquired and weren't convinced he'd bothered. Furthermore, I put my pyjamas in bed and the cleaners swiped them along with the bed linen. I asked for them back on 5 occassions to 3 different receptionists. No one either bothered to look or seemed to care! The location of this hotel, however, is great. The bus stop is literally outside the door and you can get buses to everywhere in the city. Top Tips - Ladies- make sure your shoulders are covered when you visit the vatican city - Bus 62 takes you everywhere you need - trevi fountain, vatican etc. Bus 90 takes you to the termini station. Both buses are frequent. - for 8 euros you can get a terrovision shuttle bus from ciampiano airport to the termini station, then bus number 90 takes you straight to hotel Bottom Line - if you can afford better - then choose elsewhere! If you can't - be prepared! Rome is beautiful - dont let the hotel turner attempt to ruin it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful staff”
Reviews.Author: oscarsch
Reviews.Content: We are a group of 16 people. We had a very pleasant stay at Turner Hotel. It is a very classic hotel with marble everywhere...it is quite remarkable. Very beautiful staff with information of all kinds: museums, restaurants, guide tours, private tours...we did them all. Rooms are very clean, classic also, very chic wood floors and extremely silent. they have all kinds of breakfast, one can choose from a variety of food types. The area of the hotel is very central and the main station is near. Do not take taxies...roman taxi drivers are very disonest. Have a nice time in Rome to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one the places where my family and I felt like home. We travel very often and in Rome we felt great. The personnel in the hotel is helpful, Stefano has great reccomendations for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at this 4 star hotel at the beginning of May. The price was adequate and the service was excellent. On our 3rd day we have lost our documents on the subway and at the hotel the personel was so kind that they phoned the embassy and inquired for our situation. As the new documents would have been ready a day after our departure day, although the hotel was full, they explained our situation to a guest that had to come that day in our room, found him a new hotel nearby and asked him to stay there for one night. So they let us stay in the hotel the extra night, as without documents any other hotel wouldn't accept a reservation. In the end, everything turned out just fine. We definetely, recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Taxi Drivers!!”
Reviews.Author: louise1965
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night, taxi driver swapped 20 euro note for a five as I was paying him and said I hadn't paid enough, checked my money in the hotel and he had conned me. Met 2 other ladies who had had exactly the same thing happen to them but with a 50 euro note! Hotel has seen better days to put it mildly, woken up on the first night to the stench of sewerage in our bedroom. The staff were OK, breakfast was OK, but I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! The Turner is an Awful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: indolentleopard
Reviews.Content: When we opened the door to the first room we were given, the bed was not made properly and there was a towel hung over the shower and one on the floor. We asked reception for another room and walked into a freaky, unsettling room that smelled stale. The bathroom had a towel hung near the bidet...that had a brown stain on it. I probably don't need to go any further, but there is more to relay. The shower in this room was some sort of alien-engineered torture contraption that was impossible to figure out how to use. The staff was unfriendly. On the decor: tastes vary, but unless you like chintz, dingy damask-covered walls, ridiculous chandeliers looming over your head while you sleep (or try to go to sleep), dark curly whirly wannabe Louis XVI furniture, the Turner is not the place for you. Rome is amazing. Don't ruin your trip by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is *tiny* (two people and luggage was very tight in the little elevator ... let alone navigating the halls and the revolving door with luggage) but we had a great stay. Once we found the hotel, it was easy to use public transportation to get to and from it. Very quiet location - never even heard noise from other rooms. And the staff was very nice. I would definitely consider staying here again next time I get to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “The most teririble hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
