Reviews.Content: Dirty, old-fashioned, never renovated, disgusting hotel! The bathroom was so dirty and mouldy! Breakfast- crumbs of stale bread and rancid cheese! STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and found it to be just fine for a budget hotel - the room and bathroom were clean and of typical European size (read: small), the desk staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was good but not great since it's not in the middle of the city centre. Perhaps our bathroom was a bit better than others since our shower, though small, had sliding doors around it instead of just a curtain. There was a musty/sulfury smell from the water in the toilet that was minimized by keeping the lid down. The breakfast was more than adequate - meat, cheese, rolls, croissants, sweetbreads, yogurt, fruit and cereal as well as juice and whatever kind of coffee you'd like. There are a lot of decent restaurants in the area including one fantastic pizzeria/trattoria (like a lot of Rome restaurants, it doesn't have a name) a few blocks away on Pia Alexandra?? - it is distinctive because it's pretty big, brightly lit with checkered tablecloths and is full of Italians. The pizza and pasta there were the best we had during our entire trip and we ended up going there twice while in Rome after having a mediocre dinner at one of the fancy open air cafes at Piazza Navona. While the hotel isn't right in the middle of the city centre, it's walkable if you don't mind walking. We ended up walking just about everywhere from the hotel because we couldn't be bothered most of the time with the expense of a taxi or waiting for the bus. It's a 15 minute walk from the main train station, a 15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and a 40 minute walk from Piazza Navona (the furthest we walked). Bus #62 that stops in front of the hotel takes you all the way to St. Peter's/Vatican City (the last stop), which we did the day we spent in the Vatican City area. I recommend doing the "110" City Tour - it's the red double-decker buses that stop at 11 or 12 main sites through the city centre. It starts at the main train/bus station (there is a ticket office there outside - an orange/red building) but you can get on at any of the stops if there is room and pay for the ticket at the stop (13 euros). You can ride the bus all day, getting on and off at stops, until the service ends around 7:30pm. We got on at 9am our first day in Rome at the main train/bus station, did the entire 2 hour ride through the city and then decided where to get off later. I recommend getting on early since when we went through the main train/bus station to begin our second time through (it was about 11am) the line to get on the bus was LONG and hardly anyone got off so I can't imagine how long those people waited in line.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - no complaints at all!”
Reviews.Author: Grendel666
Reviews.Content: We have just spent three nights in this hotel and we didn't experience any of the negative aspects of previous reviewers. The staff were great, case was carried up to our room (a nice juior suite) for us. We were given a map when we arrived and the guy behind reception explained where everything was, including the bus and where to buy a ticket for it. The bathroom was big enough - ok, it wasn't huge, but why do you need a huge bathroom? It had plenty of room to get undressed/dressed, have a shower, get dried, etc. The road outside was quite noisy and I thought I'd have trouble getting to sleep, but as soon as the windows and shutters were closed we couldn't hear the traffic at all - perfect. Breakfast was the same as I've found in all other Italian hotels (including some much more expensive and exclusive than this one). Don't expect a full English breakfast, because that's not what they do in Italy! There was plenty of everything and what should have been hot was hot. Location was great. We had a wander around when we arrived and ended up at the Colosseum as it was that close and basically at the end of one road. The metro is only a 5-10 mins walk and gets you to where you want to go very quickly. We didn't use the bus service as the metro was so good, but there is a bus (number 62 I think) that stops outside the hotel and takes you into the centre. Loads of restaurants close by so you have lots of choice. Walking around at night didn't bother me, people were very friendly, but we didn't stroll too far from the hotel - only a few blocks really. After a hectic and very unorganised journey to the hotel (we got the ArrivaBus from Ciampino that dropped us in the middle of an extremely busy road near Termini, with no signs of anything around, couldn't even find the metro, driver didn't care about the passengers at all, so got charged a fortune for a journey of a few minutes) we realised that we should have just got a taxi. So we asked about one in reception and they arranged a taxi to take us to the airport on the way home, which arrived early with a very friendly driver - they didn't just pick one up from the street. So, in summary, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and really think it is a wonderful bargain for the price. The location is ideal because it is not in the touristy center, but still close to everything. There are also some great little local restaurants nearby. We ended up staying in two different rooms because we left to Capri for a few days. On our last night in Rome they gave us a gorgeous suite with a huge bathtub/shower. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great experience at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sarfie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was described as a 3 star little gem in the holiday brochure. We booked it through the internet for half the price advertised with the travel agent- I would have been devestated had we paid the full price for this to be frank awful hotel. The hotel and the rooms were old fashioned, tired and exceedingly tacky- lots of faded large gold mirrors, reproductions of tuner paintings (hence the name), faded wall paper etc. Our shower curtain had also seen better days! The buffet breakfast was a sad affair- a couple of plates with a few slices of ham on, a couple of unsavouray loking slices of cheese and the occasional croissant/ danish if you got there in time. All this was presided over by a waitress who carried your coffee/ tea in one hand and held a cigarette in the other- not very appetising! In terms of position, the hotel is not central or close to any site seeing, despite being told it was just 10 mins away from everything. Walking into the city centre is not really an option given the distance but to be fair there is a metro station a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel- the walk is fine during the day but was a bit too lonley and quiet in parts for my liking in the evening. We were so disappointed with the hotel and it was such a long way out from the centre that most days we left straight after breakfast, stayed out all day and didn't go back until bedtime. This is probably the worst hotel I have stayed in, even though it was cheap- it had nothing to recommend it at all and it made Fawlty Towers look like a 5 star resort!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - Hated the Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price the hotel was very clean, in a very convenient (although not in the middle of attractions) location, and beautiful. The staff ranged from neutral to good. The bathroom for my room was average but the shower was terrible - a curtain in the corner of the bathroom that was pulled back and would otherwise just be a corner - literally probably 4 sq. feet.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Turner
HotelInfo.Address: Via Nomentana 29, 00161 Rome, Italy
